title: Beautiful Hotel
text:
The Hotel and Casino was absolutely beautiful. The staff we encountered were all very pleasant and helpful. I will definitely choose this location again the next time I'm in NYC.

I want to take a moment to shoutout Tyisha with the security team. She was absolutely amazing!!! She was so pleasant and friendly. I had a long day as I had just left a funeral. I guess she sensed it and immediately sparked up a conversation that resulted in a good laugh and an exchange of encouraging words. I can tell she has an amazing rapport with the regulars because in my short conversation with her a few people walked up just to say hi to her. Shes truly a gem and made my experience even more pleasant!!!! Her energy and spirit shines bright! Shes a beautiful person inside and out. I will definitely look for her the next time I visit. Thank you RW and THANK YOU so much Tyisha! May God continue to bless you!

title: Great stay for an overnight at JFK
text: Very nice, rather new, Hyatt.  Large rooms, and great, attentive staff.  Stayed overnight for a flight next morning to Europe and was a great pick.  Regency Club selection was not extensive, but fine nonetheless.   Special thanks to Ashley at Customer Relations and Megan at the front desk, although all staff were grand.  Only issue was no shuttle service to JFK.  Really should have one.  Would return.

title: If I could give it zero stars I would
text:
One of the worst experiences in a very long time.
I am an extremely well traveled person and this place is an abject fiasco. 

The room was fine - standard and what I would expect in an airport hotel. But what absolutely is not fine is their supposed room service menu which I ordered a surf and turf off - to the tune of 103 usd. It arrives cold and in cardboard container with plastic cutlery that is impossible to cut the food with. Photos attached 

This is completely unacceptable under any circumstance. When I called the front desk all I got is well it's your problem and this is how we do room service as it's a third party provider! At least I managed to get some real cutlery to eat my very cold steak and lobster finally.

Seriously though? This is acceptable? The menu listed room service - so l expect room service not a take out that I could have ordered better and cheaper through Uber eats. The attitude of the front desk manager frankly is the worst issue here. He absolutely didn’t care. And refused to take responsibility for what is listed by Hyatt as their room service. The food didn’t  even come with what was listed as sides of mashed potatoes and beans! I mean really really poor quality and really badly done!

Awful and completely unacceptable. I don’t normally use trip advisor to vent but use it as a memo to remember my stays and meals - this one frankly is best forgotten and am using the platform to vent and warn others of what is a hotel that simply could care less.

title: Not a useful airport hotel
text:
There are a few things I look for in an airport hotel: noiseproof rooms, working AC, a shuttle to the airport. This thing has literally not a single one of these. The walls might be as thin as any room I've stayed in anywhere, full stop. 

Because I have to write a bit more, I'll add: the plugs are in locations that make no sense, the lighting situation is bizarre (no overhead lights in the main room) and the maintenance folks are the ones walking up and down the corridor blasting music at 11:30pm. Go figure.

title: Big Hotels But whole hotel had no Slippers for customers
text: Been to visited this Hotel asking for slippers , but had no slippers for the hotel, i did walking with barefoot. is unbelievable ... at night calling house keeping . no bodies picking up the phone. seems like ghost hotel. ?????  management should wake up about what's going on. ( not just the safe cost for everythings and effected to just peoples who staying.>

title: Wonderful and cleanest go again!
text: Quiet clean and safe works best for me. I am planning another stay soon when the weather break, so I can really enjoy my stay. I really didn’t eat at the hotel, but I did eat at the casino at Popeyes it was fresh and good biscuits …

title: Hyatt hotels are always the best value for money
text: Hyatt hotels are always the best value for money. Mostly always kept very neat, and having all the basic necessities in a room, especially, Regency and above, they also offer the best value for your Hyatt Points when redeeming for a room booking.

title: Clean and comfy
text: We stayed here for 1 night and it was very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again. The distance to the casino was very convenient and was not a long walk. Check in was pretty quick and so was checking out

title: Not close enough to airport
text: Although called JFK Hyatt, this hotel is not close to the airport and does not provide a shuttle. The staff did not return phone calls in the week prior to arrival. Room was comfortable and clean. Restaurant on the property is unique and the food is good. Starbucks on site.

title: Casino night out
text: Had a great time at Hyatt. My friends surprised me for my birthday. Only complaint is not winning any money at the casino... but that's my own fault. Hotel is clean and quiet with great staff. Would recommend and return again!

title: my new place
text: Stayed here in the hotel is modern and welcoming. I was supposed to just stay for one night and ended up extending my stay for the entire trip. Close and convenient to different parts of the city. Casino and restaurants on site .

title: Hyatt JFK
text:
The rooms are well kept and very clean.  I couldn't have chosen a more accommodating location for my recent trip to attend a nearby home-going celebration.  

I found the hotel lobby to be clean with more than adequate security manning the doors and elevators. This in itself was refreshing.   

On day one I borrowed an in-laws vehicle to attend the next days funeral service and upon arrival at the hotel I notice that there was no parking fees. This is a huge savings.   Througout the night roving security watch over the entire parking area. This too is security feature that made my stay more relaxing.

title: So friendly in New York!
text:
So , I  went twice in a week's time . When I checked in there were 3 people who talked to me . All 3 were very helpful in me navigating my first trip into the city. They gave me advice about trains and busses and told me approximately how long my journey would be.
When I came back a week later , they all recognized me and asked about my trip to London. I have always heard that people on New.  York were rude. But these 3 associates at your hotel were the most friendliest and helpful I have ever encountered.
These three are : Jonathan, Zeena , and Shivanni.  Please let them know how much I appreciate them going out of their way to make this old southern man feel so welcome!
These 3 associates at your hotel really care!!
Respectfully,
Bart Pierce
251-895-2278

title: Thank you
text: The services were very good, the best, thank you for everything offered. I liked how everything was generally clean, so I can recommend more people to stay there. My partner was fascinated by the cleanliness.

title: Nice stay
text: Nice place to stay in Queens. Hotel is very clean. Staff is friendly. Food is good for a quick meal although I'd like to see more variety on the menu. I did not eat breakfast, so I can't comment on that. Casino not as noisy as I expected. I was able to relax. Room spacious. Good food in the area.

Great experience 
Nice environment 
Friendly Greetings
Starbucks a plus
Comfortable 
Spacious 
Clean Air 
Privacy 
Great Views 
Needs Netflix/More Channels 
Water Available In Room

title: Peace of Mind !
text: My visits to the Hyatt Regency at Resorts World Casino is always a treat . I try to stay there at least 3 to 4 times per month .. If you stay there they have 2 Front Desk Employees that are very polite and professional every time and will make check in a breeze .. The names are Shivanni and Alyssa C.. Also from housekeeping is Clive who will make sure your stay is comfortable.. Enjoy your next stay at Jfk and try the Casino a little but if u have the time and money 💵

title: My 1 AM check-in room is occupied by an outraged family
text: The Hyatt Regency JFK is a high-end hotel with an unusual number of security guards and is attached to a casino.  It is a few miles from JFK and I booked a room so that I could get a few hours of sleep between flights. I checked in on-line in the afternoon and was assigned room 816.  When I arrived at the hotel at 1 AM that evening, I checked with the agent at the desk who confirmed that room, gave me a key, and pointed me in the direction of the elevators.  I took the elevator up to the 8th floor, and after walking down several long corridors, found room 816.  I touched the key to the pad on the door, opened the door…and saw toys strewn all across the floor of a dimly-lit room. I swore softly and, wIthout looking further, closed the door and started back down the corridor.  A loud male voice accosted me, “Hey you!”,  and as I continued to  retreat, “Hey!”,  “Hey can’t you hear?”.  I had no idea how this was going to end, but I got to the elevator as quickly as possible and went down to the front desk and explained what had happened to the agent who had checked me in. She apologized and appeared surprised when I asked for another room, far away from this one.  She said she would need to talk to a supervisor, which she did, and then she gave me a new room.  While I was waiting, a highly agitated woman came into the check-in area yelling about someone entering her room where she had two kids and how could this happen and already that day cleaning people had come in without asking her.  I did not volunteer that this someone was me, and she was escorted away to see a supervisor. I got my few hours of sleep and returned to the lobby to check out.  I got an explanation that the family had stayed an extra night, and that somehow no one had entered that information into the hotel’s system, and that the fact that the room was not cleaned and prepared for a new guest was never noted, and that therefore somehow the room was allocated to me even though it was quite occupied, and that this was a rare event (by which I concluded that it was not unheard of as one would hope).

title: Overnight stay
text: It's worth the visit, I enjoyed my stay.  Check it out for yourself, don't take my word for it. Convenient location. Casino entertainment, bar, music, live band.  Friendly staff members,  lovely atmosphere.

title: Parking is atrocious
text: The fact that there is no hotel parking and they make you park in a an entire parking lot so very far away and they do not offer a shuttle service is insane. The night I was there it was very cold, windy, and raining. By the time I got to the hotel from the parking lot I was soaked.

title: Relaxation
text:
Very pleased, I enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt,  very friendly staff, city view beautiful,  quiet and peaceful,  if you need to relax over all perfect.
If need to do something more there is the casino and restaurants .

title: Great Experience
text: Awesome place. Loved everything.  I didn't need to go anywhere; everywhere for spotless and clean; Quick responses from the staff.  I will be definitely going back for personal vacation so I can gamble a little more

title: Great place to stay
text: The casinos was clean and well organized.  The rooms service was outstanding.  I love the ambiance and decor was outstanding.  The front desk personnel was great, they service provided was above reproach great job for the entire staff

title: Great !
text: Great , cleanliness, activity’s this hotel was very cozy. The restaurant was very well, may seem a bit pricey but you have to expect it because of the location connected with the casino. I’ll definitely go back !.

title: Ok
text:
It was decent 
No complaints 
I wish the room had a better Valentine’s Day package with the details n decorations in the room 
Service wasn’t really helpful in this regard 
Valet was not expressed at the front desk

title: Peaceful and Relaxing
text: The staff is great. The receptionists were very helpful and answered all our questions. The room was clean and bright, and the room service was always on time. Will be back! Thank you so much! Highly recommended!

title: My stay at Hyatt Regency JFK Airport at Resort New York.
text: The hotel room was very clean. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. I had a wonderful time. I would recommend the Hyatt Regency hotel at Resort World to any individual, couple or family who desire spending quality time in a clean, quiet and friendly environment.

title: All perfect, but 2 things
text: Th e staff was friendly and professional and the room was clean and spacious. The bellmen were specially helpful. But the members only area which had a coffee machine and water was only available at the same time as the general public so we were denied access. And the room key was deactivated and that was a concern as there's been unauthorized entry in previous hotels recently, and keys get deactivated when a copy is made. I had to provide my proof of ID to front desk again to get a copy. My friends all had their own room  and the keys were kept inside a book to avoid contact with other items. Besides those two incidents, the hotel was very nice and clean

title: Great love to always stay their
text: Enjoyed the rooms and such great workers everyone help out team work was great always had the best rooms nice and big didn’t want to leave water was always in the rooms love it thank u all so much for the great stay

title: Hotel staff walks in whenever they want even with do not disturb sign on
text: They entered my room while I was naked with my gf with no regard to the do not disturb sign. Will never stay here again. They do not have any upper management available at all there was no alarm clock like they are supposed to have and service really needs a doing over.

title: NYC trip
text: The event at the TWA Hotel recommended staying here because the event at its hotel was fully booked.  Unfortunately the shuttle did not go from hotel to hotel so it took some getting use to the subway to get to and from there. Obvious choice if you wish to access the Resort.

title: Poor experience
text: Located near a casino. The neighborhood seems not so safe.No shuttle bus to the airport provided. Need to call an Uber instead. The toilet in the bathroom is too noisy and kind of annoying.Overall, not very good value for the money.

title: Manager Stephanie Jailall ruined my trip
text:
I was a guest at Resorts World NYC 12/12/24- 12/13/24 and requested a late check out for noon. Stephanie Jailall told me they were completely booked and couldn’t accommodate a late check out. Instead I paid $184 for staying 2 hours beyond the 11am check out. 

When I checked there were still plenty of rooms available to be booked.  In addition there was no television service this AM. Stephanie Jailall told me there was no service recovery due since it was weather related.

title: Very good experience
text:
I liked my stay and my family to
The Chinese restaurant.  Popeye restaurant. The Hyatt cafeteria food we bought it was all great. The sugar factory and the restaurant we bought the food while dining inside the restaurant next to the sugar factory it was all good experience with the family

title: Hyatt as personal vacation
text: Hotel  is great. Housekeeping was great. I dined at the Sugar Factory.  The drink prices are a bit expensive. I noticed a marked increase in the prices of their specialty and signature drinks.  Each drink was about $15-$20 more than I had paid a few months earlier.  It effected my choice of whether to get dessert.

title: Bright and Clean
text: the Hyatt was bright and clean, as well as friendly staff willing to make your stay great. The Hyatt is a great place for meetings and events. There is nothing to do around the area, but you can take transportation to near by events.

title: Don’t listen to any of the negative reviews that you see online
text: My friend and I have been gambling in Vegas for over 10 years now. We live about 20 minutes away from the casino near JFK. We had the best time of our lives! So many slots to choose from! Such a nice people! Don’t believe the negative reviews. We actually left with more money than we arrived with. Go there now if you’re thinking about it. Check out Queens Burger in the food court. The best hotdog you’ll ever have in your life! RW PRIME has the most delicious oysters. I recommend the glass of Prosecco with the oysters. Very affordable. No need to buy a bottle of sparkling. The burgers were delicious! Very juicy! The fries are perfect. I recommend the truffle fries. With the burgers, I would recommend the bottle of Malbec. Can’t remember the name. There’s only one on the wine list.

title: A Mixed Experience: Great Potential with Room for Improvement
text:
My recent stay at the Hyatt Regency JFK Airport at Resorts World New York was a mixed bag, to say the least. On the plus side, the property is quite impressive. Being a newer hotel, it boasts modern facilities and a sleek design that immediately catches your eye. The personal message I received before my arrival was a nice touch, making me feel welcomed even before I stepped foot in the hotel. The proximity to the airport is also a major plus, offering convenience that is hard to beat for travelers.

However, it wasn't all smooth sailing. As a Globalist member of the World of Hyatt, I've come to expect a certain level of service and hospitality, which, unfortunately, fell short during this stay. Simple tasks like issuing a working physical key and ensuring the club area's cleanliness were met with difficulty, which was surprising and disappointing. The quality and variety of food and beverages in the club also left much to be desired, detracting from the overall experience.

Despite these setbacks, there were some redeeming factors such as the room upgrade and the overall condition of the hotel. It's clear that there's a lot of potential here, and with some improvements in service and attention to detail, this could be a fantastic option for travelers. Here's hoping that feedback like this can help refine the experience for future guests, making it as outstanding as one would expect from a Hyatt property.

title: I LOVE NY & SO SHOULD YOU STAY AT REGENCY HOTEL
text: Hyatt Regency is the biggest & best hotel in Brooklyn, conveniently located near JFK, from plane to luxury.  The room decor is exceptional not standard, gliding doors, glass shower stalls, bar, coffee & office space for business travelers. After work, events are numerous.  You have the casino, bar 360 to party, prime restaurant for the ultimate dining experience.  Hyatt Regency will alwas be my first choice

title: Luxury
text: Luxury stay very clean smells good stay helpful large rooms robe and slippers add class couch adds additional ambiance for guests a lot of closet space lobby is super picturesque photo ops for social media

title: Great
text:

Large room, very clean and comfortable.
I recommend this hotel

title: Can't wait to visit again!
text: Steller property in the Queens area! Feels new, clean and the rooms are huge! Very happy with the entire stay and especially the free parking. Literally a mile or two from the JFK airport and yet the rooms are dead quiet. Can't wait to stay again!

title: The more you stay the less you are recognized! Globalist
text:
You could die here and no one would find out!
After your check in... you are forgotten.
Caters to casino gamblers, dubious characters, and one-night stay airline travelers.
Poorly managed and even worse organized.
No daily laundry service. Dry-cleaning travels 150 miles  (no joke) to upstate NY to be cleaned. Incredible!!
A call to the front desk is routed through a call center hundreds of miles away.
2 hours wait if you ask for any type of services.
Forget housekeeping, the throw personal items in the trash and work mindlessly around the room. 
Sugar-Factory restaurant: Terrible.
It is a new property in an area with no descent hotels. This is the ONLY positive, I dread staying here.
I am at the Globalist level and this is ,BY FAR, one of he worst property that Hyatt manages.

Thank you.

title: Super clean, convenient to both Aqueduct and JFK.
text: This Hyatt Regency places a premium on security. The facility still has a new feel to it; the rooms in particular are very clean. The price is excellent when you consider free parking and the premium room quality. There is very easy access to Aqueduct for horse owners/players.

title: Good place to stay
text: Friendly and helpful staff. Very clean and modern. They need to add some more eating spots for casual dining, breakfast, lunch or dinner.  We enjoy both the hotel and the casino, which are conveniently close to each other.

title: Excellent
text: Great hotel.  Excellent staff which was very helpful and answered all of our questions. Room was clean with all of the amenities that you would expect from a hotel of this caliber except for the valet parking , which is still being worked out.  I  would most definitely stay again!!

title: GOOD IF YOU WANT TO GAMBLEOR JUST GET SOME REST AND LEAVE
text: Nice hotel, Abit pricey since no good amenities, like a pool/ hot tub or spa. No shuttle service. The price of a continental breakfast is ridiculous. However the hotel is very clean, beautiful, spacious rooms and comfortable beds. And friendly staff.

title: Good service and food at new Hyatt Regency JFK hotel
text: Nice new hotel with good service, good food and beverage in club lounge. World of Hyatt loyalty status was honored fully. Stayed in great one bed suite. Minus is no airport shuttle. Likely choose to stay at the Hyatt Regency JFK another time.

title: Great Hotel
text: We love this place! Jeffrey and his team give us excellent service. It’s our home away from home. Everyone we stay we always enjoy the food in the club lounge and gambling in the casino. All staff members always greet us with a smile!

title: Love this Hotel
text: Whenever I travel whether flying or driving I stay here plenty of parking, and also the casino is a nice touch. I used to stay at the Marriott at JFK, but the hotel changed to valet parking only and I like to park myself

title: Amazing Spot
text: Had a great time , Security and staff were amazing. Food was amazing. Casino was a great time! They had all of the football games on , the bar service was quick… couldn’t be better.  I recommend this place to anyone in the near by area of NY or if you need to waste time before a flight at JFK airport located within 10 minutes from here.

title: Stay somewhere better
text: It’s ok for a casino comp but a lot of things are run down the clock was broken the breakfast is ok at best the room was small and a bit dirty  the list can go on and on.Ive stayed in many other resort world hotels and this has to be the worse

title: Easy pre-flight stay
text:
Excellent place to crash before an early morning flight. Their parking lot nearly connects with JFK long term parking. Once you park, it’s about a 30 minute train ride to the airport. Very convenient. 

My only complaint was in the Regency Club, it would’ve been nice to be able to change the tv from Fox News to a Sunday NFL game. At the end of the day, the Giants lost anyway so I didn’t miss much.

title: Great Hotel. JFK is  $35 each way

title: Great place

text: We were forced by our airline into a 17 hour layover in NYC. Not our choice and when we tried to make changes to get us out of NYC they wanted an additional $1300 ea. We picked a Hotel based on our membership that was listed as "Airport"  but it was still a $25 cab ride out and back in to the airport (no shuttle) No heat in our room upon arrival it was 64°

title: Hyatt Regency NY at Resort World
text: Very well kept property. The overall experience was very enjoyable. My wife and I are looking forward to staying at the Hyatt Regency again. I would recomend this hotel to anyone visiting NY. It does not matter if tge trip is for a long or short stay.

title: Great hotel
text: Me and my girlfriend stayed over New Year’s Eve and the hotel was immaculate and the staff was extremely helpful.  Will stay there again when we are back in the area.  Everything was extremely clean and it was very tastefully decorated.

title: If you plan to have breakfast there, avoid!
text:
The hotel itself is very nice with the neighbouring casino. 

The rooms are also nice and spacious, shower and everything in very good condition and friendly staff at the reception. However, the cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired. 

The breakfast, on the other hand, is a disaster. The breakfast room is almost impossible to find and you even have to hold the room key to the badge to be able to enter at all. Quite strange. 

When we entered the breakfast room it was shocking. It is far too small and so is the buffet. When we put some bread and sausages on the far too small plates, we had no place to sit and had to eat our breakfast on our knees somewhere near the lobby. 

Hyattt? I don't think so. What's going wrong here? 
The next day we ate breakfast in a Hyatt in Zurich and it was wonderul, just like in a real Hyatt. We will never go back there even though it was close to JFK airport.

title: Perfection 🥰
text: Staff made my trip smooth. I traveled 7 hrs to spend Christmas with my kids and the staff made sure I was relaxed after the long drive. After spending time with my kids, they made sure the rest of my stay was low key and calm. I had to leave literally in the early morning at 2 am to get back to my job before 9 am the next day. Thank you guys again!

title: Nice Clean Hotel - Pass on Regency package
text:
This is a modern, clean facility. Rooms were perfectly adequate but not a typical Hyatt quality bed. We had to get the Regency package since that was all that was available. This Regency private access room is a waste of time, unless you are in the mood of greasy appetizers laden with deep fried foods. The staff was not very accommodating in this area. 
If you need a safe, clean, reliable place to stay by JFK, this will do the trick. Don't bother with Regency package unless its free.

title: Modern and clean !
text: My first time in this hotel. I was impressed bec of cleanliness and attentive staff. The room is big, bed so comfortable, clean bathroom with good toiletries! Pillows and sheets are very clean too. Hoping with more restaurant selection.

title: Great time at the New York Hyatt Regency At Resorts World New York
text: The hotel is beautiful and clean with staff on call to answer any questions you might have how can you beat having a fun Casino connected to the hotel front desk greeted us and was very helpful answering questions we had about traveling around New York City at Christmas holiday time security was present so you felt very safe wondering around the property the only thing that was not the normal for a hotel is there were no valet parking nor inside parking lot at the hotel they did have a inside parking connected to the casino but not on the hotel side so we had to leave our car parked outside in the open parking lot with it loaded with Christmas presents which made us very uncomfortable as the parking area was open to the public and not secured. Otherwise it was a wonderful get away vacation

title: Wonderful property

title: ok

When we went looking for parking, the parking in front said valet only so the signs for parking wasn't close to the hotel so brining the bags and kids from the parking lot to the hotel was a vibe killer.

title: Comfortable Stay

title: Hyatt Great place
text: We came to the city for the Christmas Holiday, Attended Rocketts in the City, and returned and had a great time at the Casino. The atmosphere was warm and delightful. Casino was clean and great service and attention from the staff.

title: Personal
text: Exceptional hotel to stay.  The staff, the rooms and the breakfast something you don’t want to pass on.  I’ll like to thank the staff especially Jonathan, Zena, Angelin, Hector, Carlos, Rohan, and the awesome manager Victorio for always making my stay so pleasant.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Poor Service
text: Beautiful and convenient hotel location. I did not have a great experience with hotel customer service upon check in and using the application. They also do not have a shuttle to/from JFK airport you must use uber/lyft/taxi.

title: Strongly Recommend
text: Fun, lots to offer, stay as long as you can in order to maximize this very unique World of Hyatt experience. The food was outstanding. The bar was fun. Loved playing the slots. Everything you could possibly need is right there all in one convenient location!

title: good hotel
text: It’s clear and nice hotel. But the front desk should be more friendly and training needed. Only one guy out of 3 of the people is nice and friendly. The manager is very nice. I stay here almost every weekend in Dec. Overall I like the hotel.

title: Poor stay, not of Hyatt's usual quality
text:
It seemed rather odd that a hotel that has JFK in its name did not offer a shuttle to/from the airport. This so-called airport hotel is located in Jamaica, a Resorts World Casino, some distance from the airport – and a $25 cab ride either way. 

As well, the hotel does mention it has a shuttle to the train but after asking three different staffers for more details and getting a different answer every time, I just went for another expensive cab ride. Definitely not coming back to this property. 

The hotel itself, beyond these criticisms, was fine. I liked the little marketplace that was open late (I’d come in on an evening flight), didn’t have time to check out the rest of the options attached to the casino (it does not have its “own” restaurant or bar).

I wasn’t thrilled that on the morning of my departure, the shower essentially didn’t work – the water came out in droplets. It wasn’t a case of low water pressure but no water pressure. Unfortunately there wasn’t time to call down and ask – so I didn’t get a shower at all. That’s pretty ridiculous. 

And speaking of “calling down to the desk,”  I’ve been wondering how long it will take before hotels start to eliminate a phone in the room. I didn’t mind, when I had a question for the front desk, googling the phone number. But when you call you’re directed to send a text. Are you kidding me? 

Generally, Hyatt has been my go-to hotel of choice and certainly there’s not much of that at JFK (the TWA is so expensive and not terribly well run at that). This was a disappointing stay and there’s reason to try it again. If you just want a simple overnight at a JFK airport hotel, you probably won’t find it. Next trip I’ll just fly out of a different airport.

title: Great Hotel
text:
stayed for a quick over night and the experience was great, will definitely stay again in this hotel.
Facility, service, cleanliness, parking, everything was very easy and convenient, I have no complaints at all

title: Great value
text: Great value, while it is a little bit of a commute to get into Manhattan, the hotel is very well maintained, staff is helpful and responsive, and the room felt very new and modern. We very much enjoyed our quiet stay.

title: Excellent resort
text: Excellent resorts world of New York City, the hotel room is clean and the staff is polite and helpful, which is much more than I expected, will definitely come back. It was a surprise that they give a suite this time, I loved it. Thanks

title: Hyatt Staycation
text: Quick stay-away for a slight celebration of recent retirement. I have stayed at other Hyatts in other states with all  also offerjng equally satisfactory service. I recommend the stay at these Hyatt franchises.

title: Extremely fun and relaxing
text: My trip to the Hyatt Regency JFK hotel was great. Checking in was a breeze, the staff are very friendly and accommodating, the room was impressive and had all necessities. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and I will definitely be staying there again.

title: Hidden Gem
text: Do give this hotel a look.  The breakfast buffet alone is worth the stay.  Excellent healthy choices.  Room floors are perfectly quiet and pristine clean.  Highly recommended.  Looking forward to my next stay.

title: Casino stay
text: Very nice classy clean room. Relaxing vibe just needs a spa. Breakfast had a nice variety with attentive staff. I will definitely recommend to family and friends. I will definitely return for a longer stay.

title: Great room
text: I enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Regency at Resorts World Casino. Room was spacious and clean. Staff were courteous and welcoming. The only complaint I have it’s about the bathroom door. It wouldn’t close

title: GREAT HOTEL STAY NEAR JFK AIRPORT
text:
The Hyatt Resorts World is definitely an excellent place to stay for those who want the convenience of being near JFK Airport, while checking out Times Square and hitting up the casino on the same week!

The hotel does offer complimentary continental breakfast for you and a guest. Food such as bagels, lox, salmon, cream cheese, hash potatoes, scrambled eggs, sausage links, fruits, pastries and cereals are provided along with bottled OJ, soda and an all in one espresso coffee machine.

There is mini shuttle service that can take you to/from the A train subway which is a five minute walk across the street off Rockaway. The A train departs frequently about every 20 min from Rockaway station and will take you about 45-50 minutes to Midtown Manhattan  and Times Square. There is also a bus stop across the casino that will take you into Queens or a connector to LGA airport (google your destination for map).

Hotel rooms are clean and very spacious, from king size, 2 Queens or select King size + pullout sofa upon request. Bell service is provided and taxi limos are provided to airport destination ( or just use Uber/Lyft).

There is a SugarFactory restaurant and select fast food spots in the cafeteria (Popeyes, Panda,etc). After 10 pm, might as well take a uber to a diner nearby.

In a nutshell, Hyatt is a great spot for individuals who want to be near JFK, while exploring Times Square and playing some slot machines for the week.  If you plan to be near times Square, then option is to find a hyatt property near 34th-42nd street.

title: If you just need somewhere close to Airport, not Manhattan, its very good.
text: one night stay only between flights in and out of JFK, and to have a couple of business meetings.   As you'd expect, not cheap, but nice rooms, reception and public spaces very good, staff friendly and helpful, made sure I used my complimentary $10 food credit before I checked out and gave me an extra hour (no charge) to check out as I had a later flight.  Issues? its listed as JFK but its still a little way away (costly taxi ride) BUT first cabbie at JFK refused point blank to take me as it was 'too close' (he wanted a Manhattan job)   And - this is theme at US hotels - the 'extra' stuff is really pricey.  i had a breakfast meeting and it was $25 per person for a very limited selection.  Not good value at all.  Good, but watch whats included and whats extra.

title: Poor experience and no manager response
text:
I and my family were awakened at 3:31am on 11/21 by a contractor performing sewer drain maintenance. This was extremely loud and continued for about 10 minutes as the contractor fed the jet pipe into the drain, sluiced whatever he was cleaning, and maybe extracted the effluent (not sure). We were not able to get back to sleep easily.  
We had selected this hotel from others in the area based on the rating, and had arrived a day early for a long international flight (>15 hours) the next day. The idea was to avoid an early morning commute from home to catch the JFK flight and to get a good rest the night before. That was not achieved unfortunately. I'm surprised that the contractor would not know better to perform the service at this time or otherwise be instructed not to do this.
I informed the front desk the next morning and they assured me that management would contact me. They also provided business cards for the managers, whom I emailed after a few days of non-response. It's been a week since then and still no response. I can only conclude management does not care about a poor customer experience.

title: My Bday stay at the Hyatt
text: I decided to spend my bday at the Hyatt. I dined at the Sugar Factory. Food was amazing. They could have given me a complimentary slice of cake but other than that everything was super. I would definitely recommend this hotel, the restaurant as well as the casino. Vibes were great!!!!

title: Great Hotel - Prices for food / beverage are ridicylous!
text: Great Experience staying at a casino hotel but food and beverages are sky high....this hotel should offer complimentary breakfast and brunch for the booking price! Everything else was great! East access to the casino and not far from JFK!

title: Stay & Club Lounge Experience
text: Check in experience was great, the gentleman welcomed us and thanked us for our membership (hence the 2 stars instead of 1) He made great recommendations, too. However, club lounge (B&D) was insulting. The woman present Friday night (I believe her name was Maureen) questioned our attendance through her repeated age and affordability concentration. She was unpleasant, obnoxious, and needs significant training. The hotel was decorated for the holidays, which is beautiful, and the rooms are cleaned well. They do provide vanity kits, wireless charging and have built in soap/shampoo so you don't have to request more for lengthy stays. They did double charge us for food so I did have to clear that up with the front desk upon checkout. When I mentioned Maureen's behavior during Friday, they weren't bothered. We spend a ridiculous amount on this card to be treated that way - I would appreciate if someone could contact us.

title: Great experience
text: I had a great experience and will stay again next month for a longer experience, the rooms were elegant modern and well stocked and I received water in the refrigerator which was a nice gesture. I will recommend to family and friends.

I would give it a 5 but I had to go 2X to the front desk because my key wasn't working. Once is okay but twice is not. Hotel looked clean and the staff in the lobby were great.  At breakfast, clean-up was slow. I had to eat at a table where it wasn't cleaned up yet because there weren't enough tables. I had no choice.

title: What you come to expect from Hyatt properties .
text: The accomodations at Hyatt are always top notch. Everytime we travel the first thing we do is look for a Hyatt property close by. You will always feel welcome at any of their locations. Great staff and a friendly greeting.

title: Thanksgiving away from home
text:
This is my 2nd time staying here @ Resorts Casino Jfk . The staff here are nice.
But I had to say what a wonderful Staff Resort Jfk has in the morning.
I went for their Breakfast in the Regency Club 2 times during my stay.... and the Morning Crew is amazing.
Lead by an amazing woman named Beverly. 
She and her crew go above and beyond.
I am looking forward to coming back soon !!

title: Better than I expected
text: The hotel was very clean,  and the staff was very friendly and helpful,  if your looking for a pool they don't have one. The room was excellent.  They don't have smoking rooms tho, so if you smoke expect to go outside.  Other than that I can't wait to go back.

title: Horrible customer service-beware the hidden fees
text:
Paid in full via Expedia. Checking out whacked me with a 10% hidden fee "on-premise" fee. Manager told me too bad "check the fine print"!
Fee was for Gym, phone, use of premises-all things that they include in their promotion as property benefits!!!
Beware the hidden fees!

title: Excellent accommodations, food, and staff!
text: I really enjoyed my stay; the rooms exceeded my expectations, the staff were responsive, friendly and professional, and the food was excellent! It was nice having a casino and a variety of food and dessert options.

title: Hyatt appeal
text:
Short overnight - great facility, next to the casino.  No shuttle to airport though. 
 Very comfortable room and facilities.  Didn't get to check out the fitness room though. 
 Hopefully more time here next visit.

title: Sleep, relax, play, repeat
text:
The hotel is quite nice especially having the casino steps away.  Great restaurants on the premises. Overall great stay. The staff is friendly. 
Security need to be alert to the homeless people attempting to get up on the floors.

title: Clean Rooms
text: Will stay here again! Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable and hotel was quiet. Parking was free and food options were readily available. Staff was friendly, happy to help and very informative. Check in and out process was very easy.

title: JFK dropoff/pickup airport with parking included
text: Excellent location, free parking, off hours inexpensive choice of food owing to casino at location, clean and comfortable rooms. I wish breakfast was more affordable than the $40 per oerson they charge but they are very close to a diner and a Dunkin.

title: Great hotel to stay and play!
text:
Nice rooms and Beautiful view! 
Very clean snd Friendly Staff!
Feel likes a real Vacation get away' can't wait till next trip. Will be back soon. Love that the Casino has a little distance from there .

title: Two days get away.
text: No matter how close or far you are think of The Hyatt Recency Hotel at JFK Airport just to get away for any amount of days your looking forward to, for just relaxing, getting something to eat, enter to the Casino, get a drink at the Bar 360 & remember it's just minutes away not hours!

title: Free parking! Excellent rooms
text: Great location for flying out of JFK. Excellent rooms and service. Use points if possible, the combination of city and state taxes plus the $25 destination fee jumped our bill from $260 to $340 per night!!!  Make sure you use the $10 per day in the market to offset that $25 destination fee. And be sure to ask what other benefits you get with the destination fee.

title: Enjoyed my stay for my wedding day…
text: My stay at Hyatt Recency JFK @ Resorts World was a great experience. Check-in was effortless and staff was pleasant. The hotel was just less than 2 miles from my wedding venue Villa Russo. As the bride I spent the evening before our wedding day relaxing and spending time with my daughter. Then after the wedding, my husband and I had an after party celebration at the Resorts World 360 Lounge with friends & family. It was a fantastic getaway before leaving for our honeymoon.

title: Experience HYATT
text: The hotel is super clean, but need front desk staff more improvement. The breakfast buffet is fantastic. The room is very modern. Looking forward to experience their suites with my family. Security men in the hotel are polite.

title: Not worth the money
text: Stay at a marriott, do yourself a favor. No hotel shuttle, no bar or restaurant in hotel. There is one in the casino but it is seriously overpriced. Not at al lwhat you would expect from a hyatt. Room was clean butthats all I can say.

title: Wonderful experience
text: It was my birthday this was the first time at the Hyatt Regency Hotel and I had such a great time. The room was comfortable  and cozy.  My family took me to restaurant called RW Prime.  The food was amazing.

title: Ideal Long Layover (16+) JFK Hotel
text:
TL;DR: This is a great airport hotel, albeit noting that the hotel does not provide an airport shuttle. Rooms are nicely appointed & the Regency lounge has a good variety of food. Would stay here again if I had more than a 16-hour layover at JFK. Overall a fantastic stay & I would consider staying here as a base for access to Brooklyn, with the A train nearby.

Pros:
• The room was clean, and housekeeping was seen deep cleaning each room & the floors smelled like Clorox. The room passed the blacklight test.
• Everyone we encountered was nice & greeted us. Clive went above & beyond our toiletry offering to bring us a microwave & larger fridge for our stay.
• Chromecast functionality works well. Easy to connect & no problems with streaming through the Hyatt app.
• The Hyatt Regency lounge was nicely stocked & had 24-hour access. The lounge included Natalie's Carrot & Orange juice, something I have never seen at any hotel lounge.

Cons:
• No hotel shuttle & not close to JFK. The Lyft ride was 15 minutes & cost $27. For those looking for a short layover hotel, this is not ideal.
• The water took a long time to warm up (in both showers). The first morning it ran for almost 8 minutes before it was warm. The 2nd night the bathroom near the hallway warmed up faster, however, the main bathroom took a long time. Not sure what the issue is.
• The walls are thin. You can hear people outside on the street, and people in the hallway. We had a connecting room & could hear our neighbor's entire conversation.

title: Excellent customer service.
text: I called the Hyatt (JFK) to check on my reservations that I had made through my Genting Rewards and Martine, the representative that I spoke to was extremely helpful. I explained to her that I had called earlier and  the representative I had spoken to was not helpful and gave me wrong information.  Martine listened to my concerns and addressed the issue right away.  It was a pleasure speaking to someone as nice as Martine.

title: Great location and nice stay
text: Room was nice, clean and comfortable. Casino is great and had good live music during our stay. We will stay again if in the area. It is very close to the airport and can get to the trains easily. Ample parking. Staff was helpful and friendly.

title: Casino and Cozy Room!
text:
This Hyatt combines an elaborate casino, western and oriental dining options, and a terrific hotel in a single location, close to Aqueduct Race Track, and a short distance away from JFK airport.
Rooms have a modern design with wood floors, excellent bedding, with coffee machines and ironing boards in every room.  This is a luxurious property priced fairly for NYC and environs.

title: My stay at the Hyatt hotel
text: My stay was excellent i enjoyed the room and room service, also the breakfast served in the morning and i would recommend friends and family.to visit the Hyatt when on vacation or even just for a stay cation

title: مناسب
text: الفندق نظيف ، هادي وقريب من المطار. الغرف واسعه والفرش جيد ارضيه خشب مع توفر احتياجات اجهزه الجوال والحاسب .كنت أفضل وجود خدمه النقل للمطار .كذلك لا يوجد كثير من المطاعم .ولا يوجد احذيه  خاصه بالغرفه . ماعدا ذلك لا توحد ملاحظات.

title: Thanks for the Top Notch Service and Great Views!
text:
We enjoyed a very nice stay at The Hyatt Regency JFK. From the wonderful doorman to Johnathan at the front desk (very professional and friendly) everyone and everything was great!

We were on a high floor and were upgraded to an Executive King Suite. The room was well appointed and very clean (loved the floor to ceiling windows with push-button shades). We loved having two bathrooms as not get in each other’s way. The view of the city was very nice even though the weather was cloudy (probably great on a sunny day).

The casino was very nice too! They have two floors of gaming and a Starbucks right outside the casino on the 2nd floor.

There are restaurants, a small marketplace, and a food court on property.

Overall, it was a wonderful stay, and we wouldn’t hesitate to stay again! Thank you for great service!!

title: PLEASANT EXPERIENCE
text: "The Hyatt Regency JFK Airport at Resorts World New York exceeded my expectations. The staff exhibited exceptional professionalism, making it a standout experience. Situated away from the typical tourist spots, I was pleasantly amazed by the hotel's beauty. In addition to the charming accommodations, the presence of an on-site casino and a convenient food court made it an ideal choice for a brief overnight stay.

title: Great getaway spot
text: Awesome hotel. Very secure.  Excellent buffet breakfast. Pricey food at hotel. There are places to eat off the premises. Wonderful staff. Nice casino. Very lovely place to go if you need a quick staycation from the family or flying in from another state.

title: Peaceful Nite
text: Stay the evening just to get away and had a great time. Took a couple hours at the casino. One money came upstairs and had such a peaceful evening. Everything was as I expected. Checking was easy check out was easier.

title: Surprisingly Nice Hotel near JFK Airport
text: On our return from Rome to Florida, we needed overnight accommodations near JFK Airport in New York. This Hyatt Regency Hotel was clean, new and well run. The staff was friendly and our experience was very good. Highly recommended. Thank you!

title: Phx
text: Beautiful resort. Staff was very professional and friendly housekeepers excellent customer service breakfast had good selection.  Did not eat at other   restaurants would stay again. Door men were great overall excellent experience

title: A SURPRISING GEM 💎 CLOSE TO JFK AIRPORT
text: I was pleasantly surprised with the unexpected NY City hotel treatment right outside of JFK. Attentive door men, bell hops and. Front desk personnel. I loved the modern decor and ambiance. I would definitely recommend this hotel to loved ones!

title: great quality very near the airport
text: i was not expecting something so good so close to the airport. much nicer than the TWA hotel, much roomier and far less expensive. incredibly quiet, even on the 8th floor.  i hear more planes from my house, and this place is literally on airport property!  i do wish they had an airport shuttle, though. the trip was $23 with uber.

title: Hotel was beautiful, house keeping on point, with the exception of me having to call for a toothbrush & toothpaste.
text: Great hotel! Great Customer Service!My only concerns were that there was a $25 destination fee added to every area that I spent money? For example, I paid and xtra 25 destination fee when I ate breakfast in the buffet area, $25 for visiting the marketplace  to buy coffee in the morning etc.

title: Great stay at nyc  before international trip
text:
The reception desk was very helpful.
Easy to get uber for trips to aiprort or city ( public transportation limited)
Very nice hotel for short time and long time stay.  close to casino for those who are looking for recreation nearby.

title: Clean and convenient
text:
The room is small compared to other casino rooms but much larger than most hotel rooms 
Hot water comes quick, fridge and coffee maker, water 2 bottles, casino is connected and easy to access 
Once the table games come it’s going to be hard to get a room

title: Nice place to stay
text: The rooms are clean and the hotel smells amazing. The only thing is the check in staff need to be a bit more accommodating and welcoming. Concierge was pleasant.  They have nice restaurants on site as well.

title: JFK
text: Very nice hotel. Very helpful because our flight got cancelled at LaGuardia. Choose this hotel because our flight got changed to JFK. Beds very comfortable. Bathroom very nice and big. Coffee service in room was much appreciated.

title: Great time at the Hyatt
text: Thanks ranch with a clean and great experience. Everyone’s polite and respectful. I really enjoyed my time at the Hyatt I I plan to go back in the future everything was excellent. The rooms were very clean. The bathroom was very clean they give you enough towels. The housekeeping was excellent. My Steve was very enjoyable I plan to visit again, and I hope to have the same service that I got because it was a very good experience.

title: Riesiger Hotelkomplex mit integriertem, externen Restaurant und einem riesigen Casino
text: Sehr gutes Hotel mit großen Zimmern und Badezimmern. Es gibt eine riesige Lobby mit einem kleinen Markt, einem externen Restaurant und einem riesigen Casino. Das Personal ist sehr nett und hilfsbereit. Das Auto kann kostenfrei draußen auf einem abgesperrten Parkplatz abgestellt werden.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: This hotel is beautiful.  It is hard to believe that it is part of the casino. It seems they don't really care about the way the casino is taken care of. If they put as much effort to make the casino as nice as the hotel it would be wonderful. The casino use ro be beautiful, but no longer. Just go because it is convenient.

title: Inefficiency and Rudeness
text: I spent about 2 weeks at this location. The casino is fun, but all digital, so not a true casino. The foreign workers were very professional, locals not so much. The key in the app would randomly stop working and the front desk was no help. I got stuck in the stairwell and had to walk to the basement loading ramp because the front desk wouldn’t answer the phone. The parking is free in the parking garage and the rooms are quite nice. However, I’d definitely recommend somewhere else if staying for an extended time.

title: Bad experience for JFK airport travelers
text: We arrived late Sunday afternoon after driving four hours to the hotel, and when we went to get dinner at the RW Prime restaurant, we found it closed at 5:00 PM on Sundays. The only other dinning facilities were a Sugar Factory birthday celebration restaurant or food court burgers and  Asian noodles, catering to the casino crowd. However, the credit card system at the food court and Grab N Go food counter failed, so we were our of luck for anything to eat after traveling all day. The hotel doesn't offer an airport shuttle so you have to spend over $60 in cab fare to and from the airport. Our room was very nice and the staff were polite. As a World of Hyatt member I expected premium service, but none was in evidence at this location. Instead, what we witnessed were working men and women spending their money at the rather loud, ostentatious casino. This is not what tired travelers might expect from a supposedly upscale hotel.  I will find other hotel facilities for my next trip through JFK.

title: Rude behavior; malfunctioning doors
text: The desk staff and cafe staff were rude and cold and refused to help or answer questions.  The room looked new at first, but the two bathroom doors would no close, one was broken, and injured my finger.  We could not open the closet door- it was jammed;  air vents were missing

title: Overpriced Hyatt
text: The Hyatt had the audacity to charge 800.00 for a nights stay, Vegas, Atlantic City and Times Square doesn't even dare charge these ludicrous rates. Why, cause its attached to the casino? And nothing else around??? What a waste of hard earned money. There certainly will never be a next time. Bed was uncomfortable, pillows rough, tossed and turned all night and nothing complimentary was offered for such a high rate.... Overall bad experience

title: Wow
text:
What. Beautiful get away for me and my wife hotel was gorgeous with super friendly staff it was very clean and I would highly recommend it to others
Easy access’s great Parking food was great and casino was fun

title: First Hyatt visir
text: The hotel was very clean, easy to see that it is only 2 years old. The staff was very friendly, greeted us when we arrived in our car and helped my wife out of the car. Always opened the doors for us and greeted us.

title: After check in you are forgotten!
text:
You could die here and no one would find out!
After your check in... you are forgotten.
Caters to casino gamblers, dubious characters, and one-night stay airline travelers.
Poorly managed and even worse organized.
No daily laundry service. Dry-cleaning travels 150 miles  (no joke) to upstate NY to be cleaned. Incredible!!
A call to the front desk is routed through a call center hundreds of miles away.
2 hours wait if you ask for any type of services.
Forget housekeeping, the throw personal items in the trash and work mindlessly around the room. 
Sugar-Factory restaurant: Terrible.
It is a new property in an area with no descent hotels. This is the ONLY positive, I dread staying here.
I am at the Globalist level and this is ,BY FAR, tone of he worst property that Hyatt manages.

Thank you.

title: Excellent Services
text: Hyatt Staff were very friendly, cheerful, helpful and we were treated nicely at the front Door by Tim, Christina at check-in /front desk, housekeeping staff (forgot her name) and at breakfast they were very accommodating and helpful. We had a wonderful stay. Thank you .

title: Immaculate rooms and professional service
text: Room was one the the cleanest I have ever seen.  Staff treated me with respect and I could tell they value their customers highly.  Excellent views of Dtown Manhattan, close to JFK airport, and great amenities.

title: Very nice...one area needs improvement
text: Most everything was five star. Check in with easy, the room was great. The club breakfast needed help. We were there tonight and the coffee did not work either morning. The other thing that seems strange to me was that the orange juice was served as a bottle of orange juice comes rather than out of a machine. It seems that was wasteful. All in alarm would recommend it to anyone that I had to fly out of j f k

title: very bad experience, not only room but also service
text:
I stayed at Hyatt Regency JFK airport last night. I want to file an complain regarding the stay.

1. The isolation in the room is not good thus I called the front desk, they said they will send someone to take a look. But I keep waiting in my room for more than one hour still no one shows up. I have to call front desk to cancel that as it is already after midnight.

2. I asked for the dental kit when checked in but it never got delivered. 

3. The bath towel is kinda wet and not dry enough. And most of them smell weird.

title: Great hotel option near JFK airport
text: My husband and I stayed for one night at Hyatt Regency JFK Airport at Resorts World for our positioning flight the next day. Great and clean/spacious rooms and overall lobby/hotel situation that make it feel like you're just at a hotel versus a near-airport hotel. The restaurant situation is unique in that you need to go to the restaurants within the casino area, but it's doable and they have late hours (including bars) so that works out well.

title: Nice place to stay in Flushing/Queens area
text: We went to see US Open and booked this hotel, Paid with points and it was very good deal.  It is new and clean,  and has easy access to US open sites and Flushing Chinatown (about 20-25 minutes drive).  Plenty of parking spaces.  The next door Casino could be an attraction although we didn't use it.

title: The Best Staff ☺️
text:
I love ❤️ this hotel, it’s my home away from home. When I have a stressful work week I know I’m taken care of here. Especially the hospitality and the young lady at the hotel lobby, Shaivanni.. She is the best!! 
Always smiling and very helpful in every way. Every time I’m there we have the best small talk and I’m off to my room with no problems. I compliment this hotel for having staff members like her to help not just myself but others who are not from here. 
Keep Shivanni Smiling ☺️ 💕

title: Great experience
text: Our overall experience as a family which included an infant was above expectation. The staff especially were very polite, anticipated our needs and we’re always willing to help. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Would definitely recommend and stay here again. The bell man, Muhammad I believe his name was was such a sweetheart.

title: Fine hotel but should not be advertised as an airport hotel
text:
If I were just thinking about the room, this is a great hotel. New, nice decor, nice touches. 
But - it falls short as an airport hotel. I stayed here twice when I needed a hotel near the airport, but only because I had Hyatt points. If I was paying I would not choose this as an airport hotel. First, there is no shuttle. I’ve never stayed at other airport hotels that do not have some kind of shuttle service. Second, the food offering is poor for those who might arrive late or leave early. There is no 24-hour room service (I arrived at around 1am, so this mattered). Room service only starts at 11am so if you want breakfast, it’s get to the club lounge or grab something like a bagel/fruit salad from the Starbucks/grab and go (which is 24 hours I believe). Third, the actual restaurants all seem to be in the casino complex next door which is a pain if you just want to go down from your room to eat something. There’s nothing else in walking distance. Probably a great hotel if you’re there for gambling. 

Also weirdly Uber/Lyft (see: lack of shuttle) get confused by the address and keep wanting to take you somewhere round the back (closed gates so no can do). Maybe the hotel can liaise with them to get customers to the right place.

title: They falsely charged me for smoking in the room
text:
I was badly treated by your staffs. I got a free room from Genting Rewards program. After I checkout i found i was charged $272 dollars. Then next day I called to the hotel for explanation and they said your house keeper found a cigarette butt from my room 839 which is a white false. I was accompanied with my wife and three years old daughter and we never smoked in our life. Neither I nor my family and friends will be staying at your hotel in future. 

I’m very frustrated.

title: Friendly staff at the front desk
text:
It is a surprisingly nice hotel compared to all the others around JFK. I highly recommend. Staff are very pleasant and friendly. Warm greeting coming in during check in in the middle of the night. I also desperately needed some tape for packaging and Christina from the front desk was very helpful in providing me both tape and scissors. I was very grateful.

Nice clean rooms. I'll be back!

title: An absolutely comfortable gem
text:
From Christina at the front desk.
Who gave me an awesome and comfortable room.To Ling From housekeeping who stayed with my luggage while we fixed my key. To the superior staff at prime. Who saw that  I was comfortable while I waited for service. Gracious and professional Hannah, Juan and Marie. The food was superb.

title: Pleasantly pleased
text: Trip was amazing. Could not complain. Room was clean, bathroom was clean, food was great, staff was super friendly. Free parking is also an amazing plus factor. Vale was an option as well. I will definitely be back and the rooms were super spacious and great decor.

title: A Relaxing Getaway
text: The Hyatt Regency Hotel located in Queens NY is a great place to stay. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are clean bright and comfortable. The beds and pillows are heaven. Love the walk in shower. You even have a coffee ☕ station. Even if u book 1 night its worth it. Hospitality is a 10.

title: Staycation
text: Nice for quick staycation. Excellent service and sleeping arrangements. Will stay again. Convenient with restaurants on premise and short walk to casino and gaming, which has nice bars and lounges if you don’t want to gamble.

title: Nice hotel
text: The rooms are usually clean but always inspect before settling in.  The breakfast was good Waffles sausage eggs pastries. It was better than expected. Definitely 10/10 for breakfast and the staff was very nice.

title: Relaxation
text: Excellent  stay, enjoyed  the rest, relaxation n Food. I loved walking around n the view.  Staff very courteous n professional  at all times. Staff also very friendly making my visit n stay very comfortable.

title: Great place to stay !
text: The impeccable service I received from Christine at the front desk was absolutely incredible. She was able to fulfill my requests at every opportunity. In addition she was spot on with her dining and entertainment suggestions. I really enjoyed the overall all experience. I can’t wait to visit again.

title: Horrible customer service
text: Parking locations are not indicated on the website. Actually the guest parking lot says "valet parking". Very confusing. The counter staff are very inconsiderate. Very disappointed and not recommended at all.

title: Great stay at an exceptional property!
text: Quick trip, wish we could have stayed longer! This is an awesome property with an exceptional staff! Looking forward to coming back... clean and comfy room! My husband enjoyed the casino! It was awesome!

title: Not quite an airport hotel
text: Yes, it's near JFK, but it seems the primary purpose of this hotel is to provide rooms for late night casino goers. That's all well and good; a smart and noble service. But to market this as a HOTEL airport and not provide a shuttle to/from the airport is ridiculous. Rooms are newer and generally in good condition, but if you're trying to sleep, forget it. The late night casino goers will keep you up. Lastly, double check your check out bill VERY carefully. Multiple charges that I did not approve or personally incur were on my bill.

title: Stay at JFK Hyatt Hotel
text:
My hubby and I stayed here for 2 nights for our 20th Anniversary. The room was very clean and accommodating.
 The hallways were also very clean. They also have best breakfast as well. This was probably my 6 time staying at this location and whenever I sm on town I only stay at this particular Hyatt on Rockaway Blvd.

title: Good
text: The blanket on the. Was the only issues. The staff was great the hotel restaurant were good I would come back to stay even. With the blanket issues and I would recommend this hotel to others people if they are travel in this area

title: Overpriced
text: I would not recommend this hotel.  It is simply overpriced.  They advertise room service but it was very difficult to obtain and was served in styrophoam containers.  Ordinarily, that would not be an issue but the hotel was over $600.00 for the night.  Room did not have any coffee cups or glasswear.  Housekeeping would not answer the phone.  Finally, located someone in the hallway to get the missing items.

title: Shuttle
text: There is no shuttle service between the airport n the hotel. Don’t sign up for any discounted room adverts. They don’t honor them. Especially if it involves getting the Hyatt CC. Even the joining the Hyatt Membership program

title: Great Property !
text:
Enjoyed every minute of my short stay. Rooms were very clean.  Arrived late so I didn’t get to check out  the restaurant options. Loved the fact they had free parking. will definitely make a return visit in the future.
I’m

title: Family Reunion
text: I organized a Family Reunion here. The Hyatt Regency provided a discounted rate for group, and a room upgrade for organizer based on availabity. We had a welcome reception on Friday, and a banquet dinner on Saturday. It’s a first class hotel, maintained like it’s still brand new. I found all of the staff friendly, and attentive to whatever needs you have. An added plus is Resorts World Casino is next door. Best hotel in the area!!!

title: Great Services, gorgeous room size!
text: I enjoyed the stay at the hotel. This is my 2nd time coming back in this property. The large space of the room is best out of all the good things about this property. I wished the hotel can improve in food options for customers to chose from.

title: Gorgeous hotel and great people.
text: This is a nice hotel approximately 3.5 miles from JFK. You will need a $27 Uber. They do not offer a shuttle to the airport but there is one to the Jamaica stop. The staff is top notch. The room was very clean and well appointed. In fact, I didn’t want to leave. One of the nicest bathrooms I’ve seen in a long time. There is a casino—Resorts World—attached plus a great selection of food! It is a great place to stay for a little getaway, a weekend with friends at the casino or a stay for a layover.

title: If you need hotel close to airport
text: Being an Hyatt member and expecting a higher level in stay, this fell short.  Front desk not so inviting although baggage attendants stood out in customer service dept .  And it was almost as if it was a hotel where those gambling came from a rough night.  Thankfully the loud 4:30 am roommates near me were quickly handled by managment.. thx Jonathon.. 2 hours of their unnecessary loudness wasn’t a good night sleep scenario .  All I can say is it wasn’t bad if you need a hotel close to airport.  If you do go, best case is to hang in club lounge it’s a lot better than other parts of hotel .  Be helpful if more people in this business smiled more .. didn’t see much of it here.

title: Too expensive to stay in this area 😪 travelers should find other reasonable accommodations , not ideal for overnight st
text: Traveller's should seek other reasonable accommodations, not very affordable unless you have deep pockets. Prices are too high especially for a overnight stay regardless of it proximity to the airport.

title: The experience could have been better. But it was not. Not again.
text: Big hotel, near to the airport, right next to a Casino only meant for business traveler and surely not for families. Quite far away from New York City, almost 40 mins drive. I checked in at 11:30 PM. Check-in experience was smooth. Room was good too. I did not find the staff experience as it should have been. Extremely cold attitude to customer's need. A big hotel lacked in basic amenities. I was provided with daily $10 credit, however the food shop did not recognize and after 3-4 days of purchase, I had to call manager on front desk duty 5 times to get billing statement corrected as the front desk was like I would follow what I want to and I would not listen to you, approach. Accidently I left a precious article in the room, while the hotel lost and found kept it in their custody, however at the time of return, they made me wait for almost 2 hours and I feel that that the treatment extended could have been better. Truly speaking, I would go to this hotel only if I would not have any other option.

title: RW Casino
text: The resort was very beautiful everything was so clean the food the receptionist security customer service the room was so very clean temperature was just right we cannot wait to visit again and would surely recommend friends and family to the resort.

title: The Best Place Near JFK
text: They have the best Beds and pillows. Friendly and warm people. Accessibility to the airport and casino is the best thing is the casino. Entertainment! Breakfast is the Best! First Class! Neat! Train access and bus to the City and Lots of places to eat. Visit the Prime Rib and Sugar Factory! Their Bed is the Winner!

title: Best hotel near JFK
text: Great hotel, clean and conveniently located. The rooms were big and spacious and the bathrooms were white and clean. The staff were friendly and near the casino and sugar restaurant. The buses and train were also close by making it convenient.

title: Accommodating to last minute needs
text: Thankful for the staff at this hotel. Always a pleasure to interact with. Due to my flight cancellation my reservation causes a bit of a problem but they were very accommodating and helpful and shared information to help avoid hotel no shows in the future .

title: Good option near JFK
text: Only stayed for one night and thought the hotel was nice.  Original key did not work and had to go back down to the desk.  Then the heat was on in the room when we entered (on a 90 degree day) and had trouble getting the AC to work.  We had to wait for maintenance to come to help us (which thankfully only took about 10 minutes).  Kind of annoying to deal with these slight inconveniences after a four-hour drive but the staff was friendly and helpful at least.  Having the attached casino for a little pre-trip entertainment was nice and we had a quick & cheap dinner in the casino food court (Popeye's and other options).  Location is very quick drive to JFK economy parking lot (less than 10 minutes) but we did not experience any airport noise which was nice.  Will stay here again when flying out of JFK.

title: Horrible customer service
text: Check in took 45 minutes despite being pre-checked in. No one came to help understaffed front desk or explain reason for long line. Air crews got special treatment from manager but everyone else waited in line. Incredible fail. Rooms were noisy and had lights you couldn’t turn off.

title: Hyatt Blunder
text:
I quite like the Hyatt chain of hotels. I have had pretty good luck with their hotels and service. This time was just errrrr.
To start the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Also, it is connected to a casino with a good choice of dining options. We atr at the steak place and the food was good.
The bad...there was a dedicated line for Discoverist, Explorist, and Globalist but at the time we checked in there was only one front desk person so the expedited line was kind of a moot point since we had to wait in line anyway. After a few minutes another desk agent came to the desk. My husband started to walk over but was told to wait so that he could check in some pilots that had arrived after us. 
Then we had trouble getting our keys to work in the elevator and then again to get into the room. On the way down to the front to get keys fixed my husband ran into a guy that was stuck on our floor because his keys would not work and he needed to go up.
We were offered late checkout as Explorist but the girl never put it into the system so in the morning my husband went down to get coffee and came back to the room he was locked out. He called down to the front and they told us that the late checkout was never entered so our keys deactivated at normal checkout time.
Lastly, if you are handicapped and are thinking of staying here before heading to JFK make sure you have a plan to get to the airport. The aquaduct metro station going in the direction of the airtrain is not accessible so you can ride the shuttle to Jamaica and catch the airtrain from there, get an uber, or go to the aquaduct racetrack metro stop ride it back toward the city one stop then get off and xome back two more stops to get to airtrain stop.
If I had to do it again I'd probably just stay at the Hilton

title: Resorts hotel trip
text: The hotel was great.  Clean and friendly staff, they even clean your room.  No more Covid restrictions, which was nice.  Continental breakfast was delicious.  The room was gorgeous.  The view was also beautiful.

title: Hyatt Regency Hotel Staff and RW Prime Excellent Sugar shack Not so much
text: Everything about the hotel was perfect as was the dining ar RW Prime where Hotel guests get a discount. Food was 5 star. But stay away from the Sugar Shack, rude staff in the restaurant and at the shake bar. First time I gave them the benefit of the doubt but the second time it happened just confirmed it. But dont let that stop you from staying there.

title: Great Staff
text: Friendly staff and very clean room. Bed comfortable and linens were in perfect condition. Lots of towels and nice bathroom. Breakfast buffet was great. Convenient to JFK. No shuttle to JFK but Uber pick-up was so easy and quick. Will stay here again.

title: rooms are nice and comfortable
text: enjoyed my stay. felt welcomed by the staffs. everyone is very nice and friendly. check in process is very easy, the doormen are very helpful. our bags got to our rooms before we even got there. would go again

title: Terrible customer service
text: Super bad customer service! Front desk lady who checked me in looks like she hated her job even the supervisor are very rude. Not very helpful in a situation they don’t know how to greet guest and smile.

title: Comfortable stay
text: Convenient location with parking. Facility is decorated comfortably.  Sugar a Factory service needs improvement but Prime Steak House new menu was excellent. Would recommend this hotel above others on the Conduit strip.

title: Sublime
text:
From the moment I stepped in was a dream.
Well done to all the staff, to keep doing all this hard work to maintain this hotel eligible for all the tourist.
The Suite was gorgeous with an incredible view on New York.
Highly recommend

title: ONLY PLACE I WILL STAY
text: Love staying here. It's become my go-to hotel in New York. Rooms are spacious, always clean, bed is comfortable and the staff is always helpful. Would highly recommend. Casino is a plus if you gamble!

title: customer service & front desk
text: The customer service when you book a reservation are not friendly ,always in a hurry not taking time for the guest which is they should be the first one that giving you a good impression, Same thing when you check in by the Front Desk all of them are not smiling, not even offering breakfast,.they are lack of information they supposed to inform for the guest.The Hotel is very nice but if the staff are always like this people are going to be think if they will comeback again, Please be Friendly and always Smile!!! First impression Last.

title: Expensive or Maybe Not, no free breakfast
text:
New York is expensive. That's a fact. This location is way out there and not close to anything. It has a casino, if you are into that...but people come here for special events because they have the space to host it and people come here because it is close to family and relatives. Breakfast is not included. The outside neighborhood is not exactly warm and inviting... its basically the hood. And you have to drive everywhere since you are basically in the middle of nowhere. At peak season I paid almost $500 with taxes, and I received no complimentary breakfast. There are many hotels in NYC that will give it to you for less per night. I suggest you go find one.

As for the hotel and staff, this location is nice and clean and the staff is friendly if not frazzled by the volume of guests. Bathroom doors tend to fall off the rails (barn door style).

title: Personal time
text: I just needed some time to relax and this was perfect! Everything was clean and accessible. There's a designated smoking area outside which is good if you have to smoke. And the restaurants are open late if you get hungry. Will definitely stay there again.

title: Meh
text:
I was looking to be more impressed with this hotel. I knew there was no shuttle available, but that still remains a shame. While a handprint on the wall shouldn't be a big deal, it was certainly a turnoff and the air ducts that didn't have covers gave the room a shabby feel. The bed too soft to the point you sank down to the springs. The last negative piece was needing multiple requests and over 30 minutes for 2 bottles of water to be delivered to the room. 
On the positive side, the doorman was the brightest spot for this hotel. He was OUTSTANDING. The people that worked the front desk were very kind. The room was good size and well appointed.

title: Special occasion
text: Very satisfied with hotel.  Very nice atmosphere, nice and clean, and all staff very personable.  it was nice and easy to make a reservation.  Also, we were accommodated with a very good breakfast in the morning.  That was a surprise and it complimented  the  stay even more.  Thank you, HYATT Regency.

title: NY Resort
text: Very clean nice place staff very friendly and helpful lots of food options the casino is huge the bars are pretty cool too two starbucks is convenient star bucks coffee in the rooms is a great option too.

title: Thumbs up!
