text: As a Travel agent I recommend the Hyatt Regency JFK.  I frequent this hotel often on business and the staff is always friendly and accommodating. They just added complimentary breakfast which is also a plus.

title: Poor check-in, otherwise nice property.
text:
My wife and I stayed here and had a very mixed experience.  We arrived at the hotel late at night and we were given keys to a room. We went up to our room on the 8th floor and neither of the keys worked. We went back downstairs and explained that our keys didn’t work and after a few moments they issued new keys. We went back upstairs and yet again the keys didn’t work. We went back downstairs and the desk agent did something and handed the keys back and said they should work now but if they don’t you’ll have to wait for someone to reset the lock. This was extremely frustrating to go back and for the multiple times at 11:00 at night.  What was most disappointing about this experience was that neither of the agents working the desk ever apologized for the issues we were having. The check-in experience also did not include any explanation of the property itself. We asked about dining and was told the sugar factory was open until midnight. Upon walking over the sugar factory at 11PM they stated the restaurant had closed. The whole experience felt very disingenuous. 

Otherwise the room that we were put in was excellent. It was clean, reasonable size, and had updated fixtures and amenities. The location of the hotel is perfect for a flight at JFK. We went to the market near the hobby and had an amazing experience with the three employees working. They helped us select food items and offered to heat them up for us to enjoy in our rooms. They were the highlight of our stay!

title: Best hotel
text: Everyone treats you like family nice and clean rooms hotel staff goes the extra mile for you I’m very happy with everyone there not one problem or complaint about anything the rooms are very up to date and you can’t here no noise I loved it.

title: Nice facilty
text:
The Hyatt at JFK offers nicely updated rooms.  We arrived at 2 am from a late flight and luggage issues a JFK.  There was adequate help for check-in and baggage assistance. There is a nice Grab and Go counter open until 2.  They were helpful in getting us a few drinks although they had closed.  
 A late check-out was needed and added to our room.  The room has sufficient lighting and the air conditioning was exceptionally quiet.  Quiet ventilation this is very important to us and often an issue. 
Not of importance to me but, be aware there is no airport transportation.  A taxi or car service is needed.

title: Thoroughly Impressed
text: I was comped a room via casino and usually the comp rooms r sub par... However  I'm happy 2 say the Resort Hyatt @ JFK was a great experience. The room was bright & airy, the bed was super comfortable and the casino was easily accessible. who could ask 4 anything more. I shall return!!

title: Hyatt at Resorts World is Wonderful
text: I enjoy staying at the hotel. The employees are polite, professional and courteous. The rooms are clean. Staff is always helpful. I feel safe and secure at the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to any people that are staying over to catch a connecting flight. Thank you to all the Hyatt Employees that contribute to making my stay enjoyable.

title: Nice rooms, awful sound proofing
text:
Staff at the hotel were friendly, and the standard of decor in the rooms is great. 
Unfortunately, this was all rendered irrelevant with a complete lack of sound proofing. When the room adjacent to mine I was occupied I could hear every single word spoken - it was extremely disturbing.

title: Nice one night stay at the Hyatt
text:
This is a very nice hotel. 
Close to the airport with the casino attached. 

Pros: newer hotel, polite, helpful staff, spacious rooms with all needed amenities.
Free self parking 

Cons:
No shuttle to and from the airport and it costs between $15 and 25k from the airport which is less than 10 minutes away. 
 No valet 

Otherwise this is a wonderful hotel and I recommend it.

title: Updated and big rooms, no shuttle.
text: Loved our stay here, family of 4. Upgraded to executive suite as a globalist. Large, modern and updated room with a beautiful bathroom. Breakfast and evening hors d’oeuvres at the regency lounge were good. Fyi no airport shuttle, it’s about a 12 min Uber ride from JFK. Aqueduct subway stop is nearby if you wanna go into the city. Would definitely stay again.

title: Impressed
text: If ever visiting Queens, this is by far the best place to stay! Close to JFK and east to get to. Super clean hotel and great staff! The casino connected was amazing, tons of gambling options and great bartenders. Will definitely be coming back.

title: Viaggio di svago in coppia
text:
Struttura super top. Pulizia e accoglienza da parte dello staff ottima. Camera super, sembra nuova. Dotata di tutti i comfort necessari. Esagerata la tv da 65 pollici!
Colazione molto buona con la possibilità di scegliere tra dolce o salato.

title: Not an airport hotel despite the name
text: There is no airport shuttle which is false advertising for a hotel that has JFK airport in the name. I would not recommend assuming they have a transfer as you will need to lug your stuff in a taxi which is not easy when you travel with large suitcases.

title: Excellent
text: I love the location. It's right next to casino & restaurant love the decor. Compliantry breakfast was a nice touch.i will recommend my casino  friends, front desk staff was knowledgeable &helpful to my needs

title: Nice clean hotel attached to Resorts World NYC
text: A nice, clean hotel attached to Resorts World NYC.  It is especially handy if you just want to plan an overnight trip or if you're leaving early to JFK airport (though there is no shuttle).  It seems worth it to stay here if you have a very early flight.

title: Absolutely amazing!
text: Everything was absolutely amazing! The parking was ample & right in front of the hotel. The check in process was super simple, the young lady at the front desk was very knowledgeable & pleasant. Everything was very pretty & clean. I would definitely go back.

title: Great visit
text: When I tell the staff is phenomenal, I really mean it! Enjoyed my stay so much I extended a extra day. Breakfast unbelievable, staff kind and friendly. Just a good vibe for any occasion..I’ll definitely be back!!

title: So so
text: For the high price I pay ($650) for one night for single room with king size bed I would expect more - at least friendly staff at the reception and hot water in the shower... None of above exist. Even room key didn't work so I had to go to find person who had to program it again.

title: Top hotel at a top price
text: Checked in late at night due to a missed flight, but it was still a very steep price. The view of Manhattan was great, and the bed was comfortable. Toilet had not been cleaned to the standard you would expect from this type of hotel though.

title: Amazing and comfortable
text: I will come again!! The stay was amazing the complimentary breakfast was also top notch IHOP style basically. I'm going back to try and win some money on roulette and get another slip for the free car on the slot machines. Hey ya never know. It was worth the trip! I will return!

title: Excellent Stay for an Early Flight
text:
This is my family’s second time staying at this property and they outperformed expectations again. Both times it was a one night stay due to an early flight out of jfk the next morning but even though it was a brief stay, they were memorable. The bell staff was helpful and friendly. Check-in was quick. The club offerings were tasty and perfect for a mid day snack as well as breakfast. 

If this hotel was closer to the city I would stay here for every trip to NYC. But it is quite far from Manhattan so getting to the city on public transport is a little challenging. And even though it’s labeled a JFK hotel there is no shuttle to the airport. Hopefully that changes soon. Overall great stay and beautiful property.

title: Amazing
text: Hotel smell fresh. There was coffee tea and water in fridge. Bed very comfortable. No noise very quiet. All rooms very clean. Shower head had great channels from soft to hard pulsating water. It was like a personal massage in the shower.

title: Nice clean and comfortable hotel for weary travelers !
text: Comfortable and clean hotel overnight after long flight! The Hyatt regency near the JFK airport was a nice surprise. We were exhausted after an 11 hour flight from Greece. When we finally got to the hotel the door/bell man Muhammad was so nice helping with all our luggage and getting us to our room. Getting ice and even arranging a car bank to the airport today! Stephanie at the front desk was also super nice and thoughtful. I guess she could tell we were exhausted and sent us up cupcakes. Lol! I can’t remember Theo they gal at the front desk but all very nice. The hotel is sparkling clean. Our room was large, clean and very comfortable. Beds and linens where great! We didn’t realize this hotel is attached to a casino. There’s a complimentary breakfast i believe but we didn’t try it. There’s a Starbucks in the lobby which is nice!  All super super clean and nice! We’d definitely stay here again !

title: Best experience
text: Very clean and comfortable will certainly go again and recommend others . Beds were very clean and comfortable staff were very professional and friendly. Home away from home didn’t want to leave the room .

title: A Blessing After a Cancelled Flight
text: I booked 1 night at this Hyatt due to a cancelled flight. I arrived around 1 am ET and was so grateful to be able to unwind in such a nice hotel AND the market is open 24/7 so I was able to grab quality food without ordering Door Dash. The hotel felt new and modern, the lobby was really nice and great to work from the next day. The team was very professional and attentive. Easy check in, check out and booking taxis. Room was clean. Breakfast was decent, seemed like an elevated continental breakfast. But, to be fair, I rarely have breakfasts at Hyatt Regency hotels so I don't know how this place compares. Note that this hotel is next to a casino but it seems pretty well-separated and the hotel was quiet and relaxing during my time there. It's about a 10 minute car ride to the airport if there's no weird traffic. Thanks Hyatt Regency for a moment of relaxation after a rough travel day!

title: Clean rooms, better choices for business travel
text: Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable, but that’s where it ends. Hotel is not close to anything and only bar and restaurant choices are in the obnoxious casino or even worse sugar factory. Find a nice Marriott closer to other restaurants if you’re traveling for work.

title: Hyatt Regency JFK
text: This hotel is the best in the JFK area. Very clean and spacious. There is also an adjoining casino with a nice sports bar. If you are coming to NY on business or pleasure this is the place to be. There are lots of places to was and if you like gambling this is the place to be.

title: Use Jiuliana to book all your stays
text: Love the phone service and thanks to her my stay was very well organized and well planned. I have stayed many times never had a bad experience. However this time the booking agent was the best part of my experience.

title: Good 👍🏽
text:
The Hyatt Regency Hotel in Queens NY was a staycation for me and friends It was a good experience socializing with close friends on a trip We had a great viewing experience of the race track and also a great city view from our room location 

leaving

title: Home Away From Home!!
text: Best hotel thus far and first on my list!! I really was suppose 2 check out from Friday 2 Sunday! But I had 2 stay another day. So I checked out on Monday! Still didn't want 2 leave!! I still felt like it was 2 short of a stay. Satisfied

title: Fantastic Service!
text:
Staff was excellent and very attentive, especially the bellhops. It was a breath of fresh air in terms of level of service, attentiveness, etc.

Room itself was excellent, parking was easy. Bed/pillows were a bit lumpy for my liking, but everything else about the stay was so great, it didn't even bother me.

Would absolutely stay here again.

title: Worst Hyatt Ever
text:
Let's just say the staff there appeared to care less about customer service and were just there to collect a paycheck.

Never again 

Never attempting to go above and beyond..in fact never attempting anything for a service industry.

title: Cunycow
text: Excellent Resort, Would love to Come back, the hotel is nice and clean, the amenities, also, the Microwave at the each floor, that's something other hotels don't have, overall i am happy with the stay at the resorts New York City,

title: Overpriced with broken TV and phone
text: We spent the night there after getting into JFK late.  Front desk person was very nice but once we got to the room, the TV kept shutting off and the phone wouldn't work.  I had to use my cell to call Sugar to get room service, and that took over an hour!!

title: Resort world Queens
text: The check in process was so simple and fast. The desk staff was very courteous and knowledgeable. She made me feel like a VIP. The rooms were clean and the beds extremely comfortable. I wish there were more food choices available.  But I would stay there again!

title: Do not miss out on fun
text: The stay and the Hyatt was fun and relaxing. the room was clean, the staff was friendly and PROFESSIONAL. My husband was excited to see a microwave in the vending machine room lol. I felt very safe because you could not enter the elevator with your room key and the guard was also an extra added security.  Highly recommended

title: I had a great time
text: My time was wonderful every thing was good I felt safe security was on the floor when I got out of my room if u need car service its right in front of the hotel beautiful lounge to sit and talk a cafe on the same floor

title: A Wonderful Stay
text: We decided to take a little break and stay at the Hyatt JFK.  We had a wonderful time, Hyatt never disappoints and we had fun in the casino and even left with money in our pockets.  Great little get away with my boyfriend.

title: Excellent Customer Service!
text: We were at this hotel for a brief overnight prior to leaving on an early flight from JFK. The room was very clean and modern, especially the automatic window blinds. We had some trouble with the room thermostat, and it was taken care of promptly. We will be back!

title: Rude front desk/ Receptionist.
text: My only issue was the Front desk, receptionist The person on duty was rude, disrespectful. nasty and short with her answers. No need for this. Very nice hotel overall, just need nice people working to greet the customers nicely.

title: Great stay
text: Highly recommend good just to stay if  you don’t want to gamble rooms are good there’s actual cable tv which is a huge plus you won’t miss sports there’s espn & a couple of other main channels which plays good shows

title: Great JFK Airport Hotel
text: Loved this hotel, appreciate the staff and the 24H lobby market for food and coffee!  All of which were delicious.  The Casino is gigantic, I didn't spend much time there.  I will be back and certainly recommend this hotel to other travelers.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Beautiful hotel. The room was very nice with cold water in the fordge, a very spacious bathroom and shower and comfortable beds. We appreciated the friendly staff, the breakfast buffet and the keurig in our room with a selection of coffee and teas.

title: My stay at Hyatt JFK
text: This Hyatt hotel is a great place to stay if you're visiting NYC is located close to the airport and the casino is downstairs if you’re into playing slots. The rooms are very big and comfortable I would definitely stay there again.

title: Great vacation at the Hyatt Resorts World Casino.
text: Beautiful top of the line casino. The rooms are very nice. Large 60 inch TV and in room refrigerator .  Vending machines, ice machines and microwave on the floors. Staff is professional and very helpful. Would definitely stay here again.  The restaurants inside the hotel/casino are very nice.

title: $1150 suite was cold and no microwave
text: I love the bathroom and the room except it was cold, no microwave to heat up our left over from our very expensive restaurant and the furniture in the dining area was not as nice as I was expecting.  It was a $1150 but started off at $850.  I’m not sure why $300 of additional fees and taxes.  I also didn’t like the fact that I was told to reserve my suite on my phone while there were 5 people there at the front doing absolutely NOTHING.  I think great service is about convenience and anticipating your guest needs.  I thought the door men were extremely polite and helpful.  Especially Mr.  John.  Every thing else was mediocre at best.

title: My first stay at this hotel.
text: I would say my overall experience at the Hyatt Regency at Resorts World was positive. The rooms were clean, staff was nice, it was quiet. The only problem and it is literally the only problem I had was the TVs not working properly. The Executive Suite is really expensive and you’d expect the TVs to work flawlessly. Unfortunately for me, the TVs would randomly shut off and not come back on for over an hour, close to two hours. This happened multiple times with both TVs. Other than that, everything else was great. Luckily I had my laptop or I would’ve been bored at night trying to unwind. However, if you’re not much of a tv person, you’d say my stay was perfect. I’d stay again, but not in the suite. I don’t feel comfortable paying that much money for a room with a broken television.

title: Excellent service
text: I will always stay at your hotel and I will recommend my clients to your hotel. As President of the Caribbean South American Hispanic Council i will recommend others to visit your hotel and Casino. Also housekeeping was very good

title: new and clean
text: I was very pleased with my stay at the JFK Hyatt Regency. The room was spacious and clean. I like that the room had wooden floors rather than carpeted. The lobby is very pleasant with nice bookshelves and tasteful decor. A pleasant place to work/relax in. I had dinner at the Sugar Factory next door to the hotel—very good food and drink.

title: $50 Uber ride to JFK
text: This hotel was nice on the inside, my room was lovely and SUPER quiet—if you care about this, ask at the front desk, but as far as the convenience of staying at an "airport hotel," it was not at all convenient. I had to take a $50 uber to JFK for an 11 minute ride in the morning; I would have been better off staying up all night and just taking the A train.

title: Awesome
text: Best place to say for family and friends. I stayed in places that I rated a one because it was no were what my family needed. Hyatt is one of the best places that me and my family have been to. I will recommend to others.

title: Dolores
text: I feel the hotel was nice clean service was good just a long walk to the Casino for handicap people. The continental breakfast was excellent great selections of breakfast food and the coffee was great

title: Birthday Bash
text: My sister and I were celebrating our birthday.  My experience upon arrival.  I was advised by the hotel representative that a $100 security deposit was needed before checking in. I advised her that when I made my reservation it never stated that.  Nevertheless the manager got involved and solved the problem 👍. Besides that the hotel stay and food at The Sugar Factory was perfect.

title: B-Day weekend!!!
text: Great property, a walk for free parking in a lot, not many options for food, don't try to get late check out on Sat if for the next day, There always "overbooked" on Sundays?. Overall nice hotel and love the fact there a casino down stairs, an added touch to one of many great thing to do in NYC!

title: Great stay.
text: Stayed here for my husband’s birthday and we don’t regret it. Everyone was friendly and attentive. Service was above expectations. The room was clean. The first thing I went to notice was the towels for spots. Everything in the room was in good condition

title: Birthday Bash
text: I live nearby but wanted a quick getaway for the weekend. The Hyatt here at JFK never disappoints. The staff is very friendly and curious. I love it here!! I asked for specific accommodations and they were met with no problems.

title: Happy with Hayatt
text: My son was quite Happy his birthday started well flew in at JFK .we chose Hyatt as destination stay Hotel.upon arriving to Hyatt recency. I saw the smile ,and I knew I did well .Expectations were met in all aspects.

title: Nice hotel near jfk airport
text: Excellent hotel with bad management  during my arrival very bad attitude from the duty manager was very rude and very disrespectful person I really didn’t like they way was taking unacceptable to talk customer

title: Perfect
text: Staff and hotel food everything about this place was perfect will definitely stay again doorman made sure I had a cab every time I needed one the complimentary breakfast was just like a 5 star restaurant I have zero complaints about this place the hotel had me not want to go back home to South Carolina

title: A Wonderful Experience
text: The Hyatt Regency at JFK is one of the best hotels that I have stayed at in year. Accommodating and friendly staff aside from the fact that the hotel is one of the most well decorated and eye pleasing hotels.

title: Hyatt Regency JFK - Resorts World NEW YORK
text: The room is spacious and clean. Bed is comfy and quiet. Love it. Casino is just located next to this building. Services are great. Free complimentary drink. Wide tv. Free wifi. Easy access to shuttle buses and local NYC transit. Good choice.

title: Excellence customer service rep.    Regards Valerie
text:
My amazing experience started with Julie from Catskills when I called to make reservations.  She is absolutely one of the most pleasant CS rep I have spoken with.  She is polite and very helpful. 

I have called many times but she absolutely a pleasure to speak to.

title: Verify anything that you are told.
text: It's a busy hotel lounge area presumably due to the casino. The hotel staff are friendly and polite, but often seem to say things to appease rather than what is factual. Delta Airlines was to pay for my lodging due to a cancelled flight. I learned later that Hyatt charged my credit card $100. I did not extend my one night stay, checked out well before check-out time, did not consume any hotel provided snacks or water left in the room refrigerator and left the room 100% intact. I was told however that the $30 voucher Delta provided could be used in the Hyatt dining room, the cost was $40 and that at maximum I would be charged $10. When I returned the keycard to check out of the hotel, I asked about my balance and was told that it was negative $30. I believed Hyatt. Good thing I checked my credit card statement. Hyatt charged my $100!

title: Great stay for great prices.
text: I will be returning back. Very clean and staff is helpful and friendly . Called front desk about the heat; they showed us how to use it quickly. There is always someone available for any needs. Very professional.

title: Beautiful hotel but poor service
text:
A complimentary stay that was not one of the best experiences I would expect from Hyatt.  
The hotel ambiance is very nice but customer service skills training is a must for this location. The overall attitude is very lax and I’m sure the amount of money being receiving from resorts patrons should compensate for the hotel to provide better service

title: One of the Best visit to a Hotel
text:
I stayed overnight at the Hyatt Regency with my Cousin and we were very pleased with the condition of the Hotel and could not stop raving about the beautiful room. Everything looked brand new and I look forward to visiting again in the near future.
The Hotel could use more places with dine, other than that I had no compliants..

title: Nice. Surprised that for the price no breakfast?
text:
JFK casino and Hyatt hotel. Clean, modern and luxury esthetic appearing hotel. Service was friendly and attentive. Rooms were quiet. 
For the price - surprised breakfast was not included.  The market food was good. 50% discount as hotel guest was a nice feature.

title: Amazing staff and beautiful hotel
text: We just had a wonderful stay at this hotel thanks to Mr. Twomey and Ashley Diaz for their amazing services.  We loved our beautiful and spacious executive suite. Everyone at the hotel was so helpful and friendly from the bellman to the front desk person. We wish we could extend our stay longer.  We will definitely return again.

title: Very pleasant stay.
text: I stayed at the hotel for two nights and was very pleased. Hotel is clean and nicely decorated. My room was clean and the view overlooking the airport was awesome. Whenever l go back to NYC I will definitely stay at this hotel.

title: Two days stay at Hyatt Queens
text: It was my girlfriend’s birthday so I decided to surprise her by taking her to Hyatt so we can have fun at Resort world casino.We stayed at Hyatt and we had blast,The rooms were over looking NYC and a wonderful,clean and stoked with water,coffee and tea.I would love to go back again in future because of their excellent hospitality which made us feel at home.

title: Great customer service!
text:
When we arrived to our room, the room was not cleaned at all. Their was trash in the trash can, towels strewn around etc. We went back down, the manager came out, he seemed very shocked this happened. He right away assigned us a new room, and an upgraded one at that! We had a beautiful, very clean room.
I was very impressed with their customer service, and the property itself!

title: Wonderful everything, from start to finish!
text: We had an absolutely wonderful experience at the Hyatt Regency.  The staff was friendly and courteous throughout our entire stay.  The rooms are beautiful and clean.  The beds and pillows were sooo very comfortable and the shower and bathtub we had in our room were to die for!  The entire staff were very attentive to our needs, anything we needed was provided promptly.  We were very impressed and will be frequent guests for sure!

title: What’s for dinner?
text: Everything about the hotel and staff was terrific!! With one small exception……what’s for dinner?  When staying at a resort I fully expect to have 2-3 restaurants to choose from.  This Hyatt had what appeared to be 2 restaurants on premises, but they were BOTH closed the night I stayed here.  One apparently was being renovated while the other one was just closed.  I ended up just getting something from their Grab and Go station……not my idea of dinner :(

title: Go see for yourself
text: I didn't see no ice machine,  the refrigerator in the room didn't work,  my drink were warm. Sink too close to the shower, I all most felled. Room is very clean. Nice view. Overall the stay were ok. It will be hard staying 2 days.

title: Just beautiful 😍
text: This hotel is in a very convenient location when it comes to transportation, restaurant and things to do especially taking a chance on the various gaming machine at the RESORT WORLD CASINO, also take a quick trip to the city.

title: Wonderful Staycation
text: If you are looking for a place to go and have fun, great food, and a fantastic room without leaving the city, then the Hyatt Regency JFK Airport @ Resorts World NYC is the place for you.  The staff was excellent, customer service was a driving factor for me, and they were all top-notch.  This was my first time at this hotel, and I can tell you that I didn't want to leave.

title: Wonderful time
text:
The experience was good. The room was clean. The staff was courteous. 
People should visit for the comfort of the room.
The TV was big enough to watch comfortable. The floor to ceiling window was a great look. The hallways were clean and quiet.

title: Great atmosphere
text: I had a wonderful time with my family and friends at JFK Regency. The casino night life was enjoyable and entertaining. The live band had everyone singing and dancing. The bar is a bit pricey but so is everything else in New York

title: Amazing place
text: Gorgeous hotel and the rooms are so new they are perfect! The casino downstairs is very convenient as well. Definitely recommended for any type of visit or stay whether you want to gamble or stay in a luxury hotel!

title: They need to do a lot better
text: My stay at resort world was boring and horrible. The staff at the hotel lobby, people in the food court and the food court near the hotel. All of them were very rude and nasty to me. Never coming back

title: My stay at the Hyatt
text: Awesome hotel.  Clean and courteous staff.  The room was great.  The shower felt amazingly good.  Food choice not so great but everything else was up to par!! I enjoyed the drinks at the 360 bar in the casino.

title: Resorts world casino queens
text: It was a nice experience and the hotel was of great quality. Me and my daughter stayed only two days but it was nice and relaxing to get away even if it was short I would recommend to anyone who wants a nice peaceful vacation. The casino is also a plus

title: Beyond expectations
text:
Got a little confused with the email sent but both rewards (Michelle)and front desk(Megan) explained it very well and very courteous 👌For a complimentary room… we’ve been treated exemplary 😊 👌 
From phone inquiries to final booking to arrival to Check out. Will be coming back sooner than you think 😊

title: One day get away.
text: I was offered a Free complimentary room in which I made my reservation & I got to get away for 1 night to check out the Hyatt Recency JFK Airport at Resorts World New York for the first time. There's room service for an additional fee & etc etc. Overall it was nice staying at the Hyatt Regency at JFK Airport at Resorts World New York & hopefully I'll be back !

title: Parking
text: The Crown is just right to stay in because it has a Shuttle bus that takes you to and from the Airport .People Were working on the Hotel, but they do need more Parking spaces! very bad and Very hard to Park.

title: Perfect!
text:
Everything here is great, the Hyatt Club, the rooms (despite being so close to JFK I never heard a plane), the accessibility you can take a shuttle to the A train and go anywhere. The casino was nice but I don’t play so I can’t review it. The customer service was great. If I knew that it was this good I would stay there instead of where I stayed the days before.

My only criticism is that the shuttle apparently is on a hurry because they don’t wait, I was coming down the stairs and walking to the door, when the last person hop off they immediately closed the door and left, a minute of waiting doesn’t hurt you know…

title: Rudeness
text: The staff at this hotel is VERY rude, and not customer oriented. And the rooms are super HOT!! At first I was not given the room that I had booked, and the front desk clerk became very rude and argued with me until I was finally given the correct room.

title: Birthday
text: I was very happy and satisfied great staff created with a smile. I will recommend it to friends and family. I had a great time. My wife is very happy. I was celebrating her birthday and we enjoyed it.

title: Hyatt JFK Airport
text: Very nice high end hotel with a very beautiful and inviting lobby, restaurant and a casino which connects directly with the hotel. The staff is friendly, courteous and always available. Our room was upgraded to a suite and it was very nice, very clean, spacious room with two full bathrooms, tiled floors all over (no rugs) and great ammenities. The hotel looks very new or recently renovated and the rooms make you feel like an elite Hyatt customer. A couple of things we didnt like, noise could be heard from the adjacent rooms and hallways. Although this hotel has the "JFK Airport" words on its name, the hotel doesn't provide airport shuttle and a taxi to the airport will hit you with another $30.00 each way. The hotel is located next to the Rockaway Blvd. which is next to literally nothing if you want to walk or find other places to eat or hang and the areas outside the hotel are not the best to walk or take a stroll. Still, this is a superb hotel accomodation if you intend to enjoy its ammenities or stay put without a vehicle.

title: Wow - such a great Hyatt Regency
text: We had a quick overnight stay at the new Hyatt Regency Jfk Airport At Resorts World New York on our way home from Iceland. And wow, we were very impressed. Everyone we interacted with at the hotel was so friendly and nice, the service at the Regency Club was great and the rooms are so cute and chic. Definitely one of the better Hyatt Regency Hotels we have stayed at. The team should be very proud and we'd definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Customer Service
text:
Great customer Service phone agent Julie, she was friendly and very professional also helpful and knowledgeable for that The hotel was everything Julie said it would be. 
Thank you Julie for your great customer service.

title: Great Hotel!
text: This hotel in newly built, so everything is clean and comforting.  The service is exceptional and everyone had a great attitude.  Will definitely comeback for a longer stay.  The drinks in the casino are made strong as well!!

title: Great stay
text: excellent hotel and room, limited dinning at the location (hors d'oeuvres) but great breakfast and a nice garb and go coffee shop, and couple eatery spot inside the Resorts Casino(but abundant restaurant dinning choices around New York city if you venture out). You will enjoy your stay. Easy to multiple public transportation and taxi service. Great staff. Nice spacious room, Hotel is clean all over.

title: Nice
text: I checked out early, but I didn’t receive a email in regards . Tried to contact the front desk, no one picked up the phone. I don’t know what’s going on. Tried to contact the person the the invitation, still no one pick up the phone

title: Not as close to JFK, Plan ahead!
text: Hotel does not offer an airport shuttle.  The trip to JFK on Uber still took 25-30 mins in the morning at 5am, lots of traffic. So plan well ahead if you have an early flight because checking a bag and going through security can still take you 1-2hrs.  No restaurants on site, only a cheapo food court with Popeye's and pizza.  There's a casino next door and a coffee shop/snack bar but it's not 24/7.   The rooms are spacious and comfortable.

title: Stay at Hyatt Regency  NY Resorts casino
text: Everything  other than heat panel system was great. The room panel is too sensitive and locks and will say restricted at times. After that you can't  adjust dials. Hotel staff tried to say I touched buttons  too fast but not true.

title: Bad treatment at reception
text: The staff were not qualified to receive guests. The room was not prepared and I had to call 2 times and the I had to go to the reception to ask for the bed that my 5-year old daughter should sleep in. We didn't get the room service menu, even if I called the reception for it.

title: Best near JFK.
text:
The best hotel near JFK.
Everything is new. Rooms are well insulated. 
10 minutes by taxi from JFK. No shuttle service. Attached to a casino, but there is no interference. Mediocre staff. If you stay longer than one night, you should alert the team so they clean your room. Train the midtown is walking distance.
The restaurant, Sugar Factory is awful, but there are options a few minutes uber ride away.

title: Perfect Nite's Sleep- Awesome bed
text: The beds are very comfortable, just was I needed for an extended layover. Easy & Fast check-in, no line. When getting an Uber they took a little while to get since the Hotel used to have another address. The handle's of the entry door from the exterior  look like they are not to be opened from outside, which was weird for me but didn't impacted my stay at all.

title: Clean hotel in handy location for early flights out of JFK
text: We stayed two nights at this hotel. The staff we interacted with were helpful and friendly. Our room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable, and housekeeping checked if we needed the room serviced or any items. It's a 10-15 minute rideshare to the subway station into the city and to the airport. It would be great if the hotel had an airport shuttle but as of now they don't. Otherwise we had a good stay and would stay here again if want to base ourselves close to the airport.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Stayed near JFK and was in town for a wedding, this is a great hotel, first class.  Very clean and comfortable room and the hotel is attached to a casino.  I will definitely stay here if I’m back in NY.  Our room overlooked the skyline in the distance.

title: BEAUTIFUL HOTEL and ROOMS - Great service
text:
10 minute taxi ride from JFK - the rooms were amazingly luxurious with Le Labo bath toiletries and so much space compared to hotels in Manhattan. this was a great hotel for a layover, I only wish they had a shuttle service.

In the morning, the housekeepers were so kind and polite as well!

title: Way to go Hyatt
text: What can I say I’m staying for 1 night layover and I could not have been happier with the hotel the check in process was very friendly and efficient the hotel is beautiful and in excellent shape and the regency club was superb in terms of food quality and selection

title: Nice stay
text: Had 2 comped nights from the casino. Hotel was really nice and staff was friendly. I don’t feel that I was treated any different than anyone else since my rooms were comped. The rooms are spacious and the televisions are massive. I loved that I could walk downstairs and play in the casino. Can’t wait to stay again. My only issue was with room service and sugar factory. The didn’t pick up the phone on both nights of my stay. And I ended up waiting 45 minutes at the dessert counter for a piece of cake and some cookies. The staff at sugar factory was absolutely horrible. Seems like once 9pm rolls around, they all shut down and act like you’re not standing in front of them. They will get a separate review tho haha. Hotel was amazing tho.

title: Not an airport hotel
text: It is advertised as an airport hotel so I went to Federal Circle at 10:30 pm and waited for the shuttle bus (per aiport directions, all airport hotels have a free shuttle bus). After waiting in the cold for a long time, I called the hotel. The guy said "we don't have a free shuttle to there". So I said "would it be possible for you to call a cab for me? There are no taxis anywhere here". He said "we don't do that". So I said "I guess I'll just have to find some way to get to you then". He said "no problem" then ended the call. I didn't realize I would have to get the A train to get there (you have to buy an $8 ticket somehow). I don't use uber but in the end the only way I could get there was to sign up for Uber. It took me 2 hours to find a way to get there. I tried to call the guy at the hotel again, but the line was closed. Nobody there. When I got there, 1 am, no dinner, no room service. Only the cheap nasty burger joint in the fast-food court, which was itself soon due to close.

title: I love the Hyatt
text: The Hyatt one of the best hotels I stayed in the past year. It’s very unique and the staff is very pleasant. I will invest my time going there as much as I can. I will bring my family and friends so they can experience the wonderful place like I did.

title: A great place in Queens!
text: This hotel is adjacent to a Casino, which can be very engaging if you are looking for an escape from the hotel. The Casino was not crowded and smoke free and clean which I appreciated.  There are a couple of dining options, but the hotel "cafe" seems the best, if some entertainment opened associated the casino (music?) This could be a great destination!

title: Most welcoming and caring staff
text: Most of the staff are from the Caribbean, which is one of my favorite places to travel because of the kind nature of their culture. I was attended to by the staff on several occasions, and many of times it took me by surprise. I have not one complaint, which is rare in these hectic times. They welcomed me like family. Make sure to find and say Hi to Umraw the security guard, he is a gem. Thank you to the people of Hyatt JFK :)   Awesome Holiday decor.

title: A Wonderful place to stay!!!!
text: I enjoy staying at the Hyatt Regency in JFK airport at resort world New York because it’s convenient close to the airport. The casino is great.!!!! That’s a different places to enjoy a great meal, they also have an “It’s Sugar” there, Drinks are out of this world, it’s the only place I stay When I’m in New York

title: Perfect hotel near JFK
text: The nicest Hyatt that I have ever stayed with. Near JFK airport but very quiet inside the rooms. Rooms are very clean and modern. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The late checkout for us was excellent and we were able to stay in the room for an extended time.

title: Excellent Choice
text:
All I can say is AWESOME!    I tend to be pretty critical, but I found no complaints here.  

The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in - even better than my own bed.  I usually bring my own pillow, but forgot it in the rush to leave my house.  The pillows provided were perfect.  There were several kinds - from soft to firm.  I found one that was perfect for me. 

The room was very large.  The TV was huge - maybe 70 inch?  The bathroom was large and the shower was large as well.  There were nice amenities as well - body wash, shampoo and conditioner.  

There was no negatives to my stay.  Well, issues with the room key, but it happens!  Great stay.  Wish every hotel was this good.

title: ONE NIGHTER
text: All was well, except noisy (loud Humming) circulation system.  took a long time for room to heat up.  Everything else was fine.  Microwave would've been nice.  very spacious and comfortable.   I didn't check, but a tub would be nice too. overall, very good.

title: Relaxing
text: When I wanted to relax for a few days the Hyatt Regency at JFK Airport at Resorts World New York is the best hotel to stay ,when my friends and family are traveling that’s the hotel I told them to stay its very clean and the beds are very comfortable.

title: Check In Staff can be better
text: Overall stay was good. Check in staff needs customer service training. Not because my stay was a complimentary night does not mean I need to be treated in a negative way. In life you never know who you at entertaining at a customer service desk.

title: Short and sweet
text: I made mistake and missed my flight back home and needed a place to stay (was staying with family prior) booked the night before and was accommodated wonderfully will look to stay if I'm in new york. A wonderful experience!

title: Frustrated and Disappointment
text:
Knowing I might be secure a early check in since my flight arrives at 6am, I booked a room on the previous night, and I called Hyatt hotline and make sure they won’t cancel my room even if I don’t show up. 
The phone lady was very helpful and gave specific instructions for mobile check-in. When I tried it right I got into the plane but some weird message saying I can’t check in.
When I got to the front desk, a lady told me my room is cancelled because I didn’t check in last night. I explained and she kept saying nothing she can do and blames me for not checking in the night before. 

And she mumbled about there was a system problem that mobile checkin not working. So IT IS THE HOTEL issue! 
I think the manger heard us and came out and talked to that rude front desk lady and she came and gave me the room. 

So there WAS something she could do and she just doesn’t wanna do it!! her attitude was so bad anwhen I said bye to her she didnt even look me! What kind of 4 star hotel is this???? 

The room was nice and big like other Hyatts, I have no problem, but terrible customer service

title: A place to be called home
text: I enjoy my stayed at Hyatt it was an amazing experienced and wonderful environment. I love to stay again and again. I can recommend to my friends and family back home. Very worthy to to stay and very comfortable. It was an amazing stay.

title: Excellent
text: The hotel was clean! The beds were comfortable. The only let down was the ridiculous wait for check in even when we got to the hotel at 1 am. And the next day we had the opportunity to meet the rude snack store cashiers. But besides that everything else was great

title: MC
text: I had a wonderful experience. The bed was very clean with soft plush pillows. I had a wonderful night mostly the news etc on a very large modern TV after my meeting ended. I am looking forward to returning very soon. I can't wait.

title: One night stay
text:
Booked this hotel as part of my travel journey through JFK.  Needed a place to stay in between domestic and international flights.  The hotel is about 15 min from JFK sand is attached to a casino.  

Not sure how old the hotel is but it appears new and is modern.  The rooms are very nice, great bed and furniture.  A large bathroom.  A very functional room. My only complaint is the noise between rooms.  On either side of me I could hear the tv and conversations.  In all of my hotel stays I don’t think I have ever experienced a worse transfer of noise between rooms.  It did quiet down during the overnight.  

The hotel did not have a bar or restaurant on site but does refer you to the casino where you have options such as the Sugar Factory, a food court and a steak house (which was closed during my stay for a remodel).  The hotel does have a market i which you can purchase sandwiches, salads and other grab and go food.  They do offer beer and wine to take with you.  

Overall the staff was pleasant but due to the noisy room I am not sure if I would stay again which is too bad since the hotel offers a lot.

title: FEA
text: I had a great time at this hotel it was very nice and clean the room was outstanding and I was very happy I recommend this hotel to all you will definitely be happy with your stay I cannot wait to go back for a few days thank you so much I was so happy and relaxed thank you so much I will definitely be back

title: Just beautiful 😍
text: This hotel is in the Resorts Would Casino NYC, the location is perfect distance to and from the airport and the city also there's a lot of different restaurants to choose from in and out of the casino, and remember you can also try your luck in the casino.

title: Home Away From Home
text: From start to finish this was an amazing experience. I truly recommend this hotel location to all who want have fun and relax. The room was clean and spacious with lots of amenities to choose from. Book your stay now!

title: EXCELLENT
text: my review is that this is a great place to visit very clean very quiet cant wait to visit again hyatt is great place to visit seem like your on vacation and you can play the slots at the same time highly recomend that you all visit

title: Hyatt delivers on beauty of hotel; staff not so much-poor
text:
I absolutely love to stay with the Hyatt brand when I travel and I travel at least 6 months out of the year.  The hotel was very nice and the room was very up to standards.  In fact above standards, would definitely stay in the room again.
The front desk staff made so many mistakes on my credit card that put at least 5 different holds on it for various things and when I inquired about it, the front desk was rude and didn't care about my concerns.  Had to to talk to 2 managers regarding the issues.  ! tried to fix it, but the 2nd didn't care.  The day I checked out, asked for my receipt, the hotel staff gave me some weird Folio that didn't have my room information (something about a food or beverage charge only??).  When I looked at my credit card onlline, the hotel charged me a whole new charge for additional room at check out???  I am absolutely disgusted with this hotel staff and the callous way they treat guests.  I expect to hear from Hyatt regarding this incident.  Even though I love the Hyatt brand, will not stay at this particular location again.

title: My state was very comfortable and professional and I will pass this on to my family and friends I loved it I'll give it
text: Get get up let's go you will enjoy yourself you only live once and this is a place to go to enjoy yourself relax gamble eat and live life go shopping I even got in some fishing with this pick up somebody from the airport and we sat back and we gambled and we talked and we was amongst friends and family and we had a very good time we went out and we shopped and just enjoyed the days the two days we were together was pushed in the five days I'm looking forward to coming back and so is my friends and family Hyatt you did it this time in Queens New York I am looking forward to coming back again I thank you very much my friends want to come back I got people coming from Florida from North Carolina coming in I'm looking forward to booking a state somehow so when they get here they will have a comfortable place to stay no worries comfortable Crime Free security is the greatest you have nothing to worry about you all very well taken care of at the Hyatt establishment looking to bring it more of my family and friends down to have a great time looking forward to coming next week for the musical show that they're giving at the casino thank you very much God bless and stay safe you your staff and your family

title: Excellent Hyatt
text: Great property and wonderful staff especially Hannah! We were upgraded and the room was awesome. Hannah helped us out and went above any expectations to see to our needs. We loved the location and regency club. We had a fabulous stay.

title: Brand new hotel, super clean and upscale
text:
Excellent stay for a Hyatt  Globalist with an upgrade to a suite. Enjoyed the separate bathtub, club lounge and extra large Televisions.
Super clean and new, Fitness a bit small for such a nice and big hotel.

title: Hyatt Regency JFK - Amazing
text: Beautiful, clean and friendly hotel. Very accommodating and professional staff. We will definitely return and share our experience with our friends. The food, hospitality and service were top notch. Best Hyatt regency we have been to in a long time.

title: BY THE TRACK
text: Went to watch the breeders at the big A at Belmont after a fantastic day watching the Breeders Cup and the live racing from the Big A it was a pleasure to have only a short walk into The World Resorts casino and the Hyatt Hotel to one of the most comfortable King Beds i have ever slept in, in a hotel the pillows were also out of this world the room was spotless Kudus to the Housekeeping ,perfect stay perfect location to wine dine and race and play some slots

title: Great Hotel!
text: Stayed here over the weekend with my family for my Dad's funeral and we are so glad that we did.  The hotel is super clean, and the staff is friendly.  The casino is a nice tough. I will always stay here when visiting NYC.

title: Expérience
text:
Très bon séjour non prévu mais excellent 
Très bel hôtel situation proche de JFK
Chambre très agréable 
Un énorme casino se trouve dans l’hôtel et permet de se distraire sans sortir 
Bravo pour y avoir pensé et réalisé sur le modèle américain où tout est gigantesque

title: Horrible Customer Service
text:
The market shop / Starbucks . The employee stared at me and waited two mins before she said "yes cann I help u"?

Front desk has a bigger size dude with a birthmark or alopecia on his lip . He thinks because it's a comp room we should get the worst rooms.

title: Meet with friends at jfk
text: The hotel was beautiful I mean it's amazing a nice place to get together with your friends we enjoyed ourselves I recommend couples to go together a great experience. Sugar Factory was the place to eat. The food was great and the drinks were better.we had a wonderful time with friends

title: Julie in Transit
text: Office floor manager: Hanna De Gannes- was attentive,kind,humble,and willing to help. Also pleasant and a people person. Thanks also for the helpful 'bellman' and informative taxi driver! Kind Regards

title: Exceptional staff immaculate hotel.
text: I have stayed at many hotels all over the country and I've never had a better experience.  The staff was so attentive and kind.  The room far exceeded my expectations.  This hotel is at the very top of my hotels to stay at now.

title: JFK Airport Stay
text: This is a beautiful new hotel and the staff is great! I had an early flight out of JFK the next morning, so I didn’t get to spend too much time here. The the lobby, room, and club lounge were all super nice and clean. This is my new go to hotel when flying out of JFK.

title: Great Airport Spot
text:
We stayed at this hotel our first and last nights in NYC. We were upgraded both times and absolutely loved the suites we were put in. Everything is brand new and we enjoyed everything in the rooms. From super soft bath robes to good-sized TV's to the workspace and second bathrooms, the room was perfect for us. Though this hotel is roughly an hour from Manhattan, if you need to be in the area, it's great. 

Breakfast was solid. Though there weren't a ton of options, the food was good quality. Staff were well-trained, but, that being said, there were some loud, obnoxious customers in the lobby that made it mildly uncomfortable.

title: Roomy, clean and convenient for an early inbound/outbound flight from JFK!
text:
Roomy, clean and convenient for an early inbound/outbound flight from JFK!

Our flight arrived at JFK early morning and planned to store our luggage at the hotel and start our day.
So I put in an early check-in request before I landed and didn't really think that they would be able to accommodate since it's way before the regular check-in time.  When we arrived at the hotel around 10am, front desk told us it's not ready (without asking my info.). However, when we were about to leave, I received a notification from the Hyatt App that THE ROOM IS READY, and we could just use our digital key from the app to access the room!  How nice and convenient!

The hotel also provided free shuttle service to the subway station.  So we can just take subway to downtown Manhattan.

If you do not like the tiny room and noise in downtown, I highly recommend you to stay in this Hyatt Regency!

title: JFK Hyatt
text: The hotel is really nice and clean the casino was nice as well, however I didn’t see anything regarding there being a casino on site. The barstaff was very nice and friendly. The location near the airport made the commute quick and easy

title: A Must Stay
text: This hotel is very clean, staff are very friendly and having a casino on property is an attraction as well.  This is my go-to hotel when I go in/out of JFK.  They have a restaurant on-site which I highly suggest making a reservation for!!!  They were slammed the whole time!

title: Enjoyed our stay
text: Nice hotel, great staff. Cab fare from JFK airport was about $20.00.  It is connected to the casino for which I had some concerns given the negative reviews. Turns out that the casino was also very nice.  Not crowded, smoke free, clean, helpful staff (who could be hard to find at times) and I felt relaxed and safe.  Some slot machines were  broken but this was not really an issue given the number of machines in the facility.  Within the casino is a a food court with a  few eating options. Last but not least we actually won a little money!

title: Very Nice Room - Convenient Location
text:
Stayed at the Hyatt due to the proximity to JFK and we are Hyatt members.  The hotel was very nice, and the staff were very helpful and friendly.  Our room was outstanding.  Large, clean and quiet.  
My only complaint is the "free" shuttle service really is a misnomer. It actually will cost you approximately $10.50 per person to take the Airtrain to the subway A Train, to the Aqueduct stop where the non-existent shuttle is.  Since that is the stop for the casino and hotel you simply walk from the subway train stop to the hotel.  You can uber it for less money and a fraction of the time.

title: Excellent service
text:
This hotel was beautiful with great service!! It was pricy but worth every penny!!
The room was nice and cozy and we received great service. I can't wait to visit again!!
Next time I will hit the casino!!!

title: Top notch
text: Hotel was clean, staff were friendly, & the amenities were amazing! I would definitely come here again. Unfortunately for me I was only here for 1 night but would love to be here for more than that. Will come again!

title: Terrible Hotel
text: It was dirty hotel. The hotel rooms looked very unwelcome. People was there terrible. Imagine going into 3rd world hotel where everything is just set up terrible. Elevator was shaking. Disappointed on Hyaat!

title: Stellar Hyatt Property near JFK
text: Hyatts have a reputation for being consistently focused on traveler comfort and convenience. The Hyatt Regency JFK is one of the best at meeting the brand promise. Every employee takes pride in the work they do - and it shows. From simple consistent greetings to the way that each staff member performed their function, we were extremely impressed. This is fast becoming one of my favorite Hyatt properties!

title: Hell, modern, sauber
text: Alles funktionierte. Parking inkl., im Starbucks gibts richtigen Kaffee, Joghurt mit Müesli, Gemüse mit Dipp Saucen. Unterhaltung im Spiel Casino. Bahnstation mit Direktfahrt nach Manhattan. Preis Leistung stimmt.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: I highly recommend this hotel, it’s a very nice and clean hotel, my room was very spacious and it was very clean, hotel staff was great as well, and a very great price. Right by JFK , I definitely will be back.

title: Nice and new
text: Nice and new hotel.  My room was very clean and comfortable.  All of the staff were nice.  Great gym.  On site restaurant and market but they’re ridiculously expensive.  Food court in casino is terrible.  You can walk to nearby restaurants.  I would certainly stay again.

title: Not convenient to JFK at all
text: Don't be fooled! This is not an "airport hotel".  There is no airport shuttle. You have to take the airtrain and the A-train to get here--for almost $12 a person each way.  Not convenient to the airport at all. It's a lie to have "JFK Airport" in the hotel name.

title: Great place, but Sugar Factory should stay open as advertised
text: The hotel and room were very nice, but I was upset that we were supposed to get rooms erocce until 1am from the Sugar Factory, but they inexplicably decided to close early around midnight. The concierge was dismissive and unhelpful when questioned.

title: Great time be back soon
text: Great overall experience from checking in to checking out the staff was friendly and helpful the room was clean and nice size I ordered room service the food was good and I walked around it was just a great atmosphere

title: Nice hotel
text: Nice spacious rooms. Clean & nice amenities. Would recommend for any type of visit. Food needs improving in terms of more restaurants. Added bonus, large parking lot, helpful staff & casino right next door

title: Quality hotel serving JFK and NYC
text:
While NYC is relatively safer than other big cities in the US, the area near the airport isn’t the greatest.  Despite JFK being the premier international gateway for the East Coast, the airport is plagued by terrible hotel accommodations. Save for the TWA Hotel, the Hyatt Regency is the only quality airport hotel serving JFK. It’s also the only casino in NYC and uses it’s position to leverage Manhattan level pricing in Queens, even outside the weekends and holidays. 

Frustratingly, the hotel still commands high prices despite being one of the few airport hotels to NOT offer an airport shuttle. However, it’s adjacent to Aqueduct Racetrack A-Train Station with a pedestrian bridge that connects to the casino and provides free shuttle service to/from Aqueduct-N. Conduit. The A-Train is the longest NYC subway line and provides access to Manhattan and Brooklyn. Due to the area and the casino, there’s a heavy presence of private security, NYPD, and occasionally even federal agents. The casino has multiple F&B outlets for hotel guests to utilize. The Regency Club food quality is superior to others in the US, but the hotel itself has no restaurant and the breakfast quality in the lounge is not a sufficient substitute.

Room hardware is fantastic with suites even get motorized shades and Le Labo bath products, typically reserved for luxury hotel brands like Park Hyatt. Service is great too especially when NYC service culture can be questionable. Friendly overtures which are rare for the city can be found at the Hyatt Regency JFK.

Excellent recognition as a Globalist member and implementation of the World of Hyatt program. US properties tend to fall short on delivering to the large base of domestic World Hyatt members, but the Hyatt Regency JFK exceeded expectations. For going above and beyond, I want to acknowledge Alex for allowing me to check in early by providing an alternate room when my original room wasn’t available and Zeena for arranging my original accommodation to be available at the earliest possible time. Carlos and Charlie have been indispensable as bellmen. Also Jeffrey, Jonathan, and all the wonderful FD and Regency Club staff have provided great service. 8th Floor housekeeping have been flawless and provided 5 star service. I’m very impressed with the property.

title: The best hotel at JFK area.
text: It’s a luxurious hotel, staff was kind and friendly.  The room was cleaned and filled with luxurious things. Every single room has a big and wonderful Tv. I do recommend staying at Hyatt Regency JFK Airport at resorts World New York.

title: Great!
text: Excellent stay as always after casino night and very much relaxing. So far never disappointed. Staff very much friendly, helpful and welcoming. Housekeeping staff stays on top of your needs as well. Of course I will be back.

title: Convenient JFK Hotel stay
text: Good hotel with excellent amenities close to JFK. Pity there is no  shuttle service for airport , however concierge service was excellent to arrange for private transportation. Factor in a bit extra for this stay to provision for airport transport.

title: Wonderful stay near JFK
text: This property treats globalists very well. They upgraded me to a suite and allowed me to check out late since I had a later flight. The front desk is very kind and goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. Hotel is in pristine condition and the rooms are fabulous! Can’t wait to return!

title: Enjoyable
text: Beautiful place; comfortable stay; clean and obviously newly built.  Easy access by car and NYC subway. I highly recommend to anyone coming to NYC for a visit.  Casino is adjacent to the hotel. Lots of fun.

title: Very Clean
text: Very clean and nice! Great location! I grew up in Carnarsie/Brooklyn about 15 min away. This is a great area with great restaurants. If you like to gamble, the casino is connected and huge. If you have never lived in Brooklyn or any NY area, you must go Richie's Italian Ice and get the Vanilla Chip!!!

title: Fantastic Globalist Recognition
text: Loved our stay.  Upgraded to a huge suite as a Globalist. Two full baths and large living room. Le labo toiletries were fantastic. Lounge is open and had really good food at happy hour that could serve as a free dinner. Breakfast in the lounge was just ok. Staff was five star quality and super helpful. We stayed for a trip to Coney Island and the Hamptons with our teenager and hotel is well located for both. Free parking.  The Sugar Factory on property was fun. I would absolutely return.

title: Excellent hotel near JFK
text: Due to our plane arriving too late to fly home we overnighted at the Hyatt Regency JFK. We did not get to enjoy the facility long, but what we saw and experienced was very nice. The gentleman who checked is in and out was over the top helpful. The snack bar lady was exceptionally nice and even offered to brew my very southern wife some sweet iced tea. Those extras are much appreciated.

title: Nice property, good location
text:
Nice property with pleasant and efficient staff provides a good experience. 

One drawback: the hotel is listed as a Jfk hotel, but there is no efficient or complimentary transfer. Guests will need to us a taxi or ride service to reach the property from Jfk. Some transfer, even iof prepaid, would add value to the hotel experience.

title: QUEST BEST HOTEL
text:
rated excellent for accommodation and service. staff is professional.
speciality restaurant would be an asset. rooms are comfortable and clean. house keeping response to our needs were met. security on a late night was great in the hotel lobby.

title: High quality experience
text: It just made sense to book a room here as we had an early morning flight out.  The overall experience exceeded our expectation.  We especially appreciated the World of Hyatt benefits.  Would definitely return.

title: Wonderful
text: All wonderful and will book again and again , very happy with service and staff, room very comfortable, very convenience, nice to have casino close to hotel , lots of security guards around 24/7, very relaxing

title: Great Hyatt option near JFK
text:
For an airport area hotel, this Hyatt regency is excellent. Nice and new and as Hyatt globalist we were upgraded to a 1br suite before arrival. 
Breakfast spread was fine in the executive lounge - nothing fancy. 
Ubers to the airport take about 10-15 min and cost about $20. 
Would definitely stay here again when arriving at JFK.

title: Great
text:
My flight was cancelled and I was concerned about getting back to relatives and back in time to ca tdd channel my new flight. I was apprehensive about where the airline would host and had images of substandard accomadations but I was pleasantly surprised when I entered the hotel. Jeffery was excited, warm and helpful at the service.  
The room was clean and fresh and all round inviting I would stay again.

title: Wedding Weekend (locals and visitors mixed)
text: We had our wedding at Russo’s and stayed here for the weekend along with a few quests. We live in Queens but this was the easiest / most central location. The hotel is gorgeous, the staff was so helpful. Chase at the front along with several others went above and beyond for us - we had kids, elders, photographers, etc. And they were always happy to help with everything. The security is great - easy breakfast and sugar factory option for lunch. We decided to take pictures in the lobby and thankfully we did as it rained all day :) but they had beautiful flowers and so spacious. Most of all they were just nice. A wedding party can be a lot to handle and there was never a complaint. It’s also only 10 minutes from Russo’s so it’s a quick great option. I’m grateful we chose to stay here instead of at home with guests all over the city.

title: Best airport hotel near JFK
text: This Hyatt hotel near JFK is brand new and just 10 minutes away from the airport by Uber (under $20 each way). This hotel may not have a free airport shuttle, but it has a lot going for it. We chose this hotel to use one of our free night Hyatt certificates. Since our flight on the next day is at 8pm, we also wanted to enjoy Globalist benefits in this place. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a $1000 executive suite and we got free breakfast and 4pm check out. The executive suite is one of the most beautifully designed suites we have ever stayed from any hotel brand in the world. There are two full bathrooms, sitting area, comfortable king bed, two sinks and a shower along with a bath tub. They have two luggage racks, which is rare to find in any hotel. Room temperature was nicely at 65 degree F when we walked in. We can't find anything wrong with the room which has excellent décor and this is one of the best places in NYC to use Hyatt points for a night. There is also adjacent casino to try your luck and several restaurants/food courts.

title: Casino and a Race Track
text:
Stayed for a night recently. Couple things to recall about this location.

1. The hotel is new and near the Aqueduct Racetrack A train station. You can walk it from the Train Station to the hotel if you wish. 

2. Hotel staff was fantastic and was courteous and respectful. I appreciate them taking the extra steps to service my unusual situation and needs. 

3. It's labeled as a JFK Airport hotel, but it did not have a hotel airport shuttle from JFK airport. I had to Uber to and from the airport. Disappointed that an 'Airport' hotel did not have this service with the airport it has its name. 

4. The hotel has a casino. If you're into gambling, perhaps this is the hotel for you. 

5. It had a cafe downstairs in the lobby. Prices were actually reasonable.

title: Terrible service in beautiful packaging
text: Hotel instalations, rooms and decor are superb. But service completely brings it all down. Internet and TV was not working and staff was rude and unhelpful. Grab and Go market a complete ripoff. $100 for two packaged sandwiches, 1 salad, 2 soft drinks, a yogurt, and a cupcake. Big disappointment.

title: ZENLIKE AIRPORT HOTEL WITH A CASINO
text: What an absolute GEM this hotel! Such a beautiful property , smells great, looks great, and the experience from check in to check out is 5star all the way!  The rooms are beautiful, spacious, with cozy beds, great amenities and super clean. This was a  multipurpose trip for me, I did a quick family getaway and also this was a site inspection for VIP travelers I manage.  The manager Chase is an absolute DELIGHT ! I look forward to returning back real soon.  DON'T GO THERE ( DON'T WANT THE SECRET TO GO OUT -  HAHA ) oh , and don't call this paradise an airport hotel...  it really is amazing. Bonus that the casino is there ...  you will have fun!  ( PS they are expanding too)

title: Great hotel near JFK
text:
They know how to appreciate globalists at this property. We received an upgrade to an enormous suite and had a delightful breakfast in the lounge. I had a chance to visit the workout room that was well equipped. Only negative, they had no shuttle to JFK but the Uber ride was $22.00. 

This is a great Hyatt property with a phenomenal  staff!!

title: Great Staff
text: Hotel is very nice but finding is little difficult. Very clean and helpful staff who will ensure your staff is comfortable. We arrived early after overnight flight and the lady at front desk was very nice and found us a room. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Will stay there again.

title: Casino trip
text: Hotel is beautiful and very cinvient to Hfk and NYC and Long Island There a very large Casino there with plenty of machines and table games and and big bar with entertainment and restaurants  overall it's a beautiful hotel

title: Will Not Stay Here Again
text:
First of all, I love Hyatt and stay at them regularly,  I even cashed in some points to stay here for an overnight stay before an early morning flight.  Never again.

We arrived at JFK around 11 pm, thanks to a 90 minute delay in getting a landing gate.   I called the hotel to locate the shuttle service, something nearly ALL of the major chains provide free of charge. 

First it took 10 minutes for someone to answer the phone.  Then we were told that Hyatt does NOT have an airport shuttle.  What followed was as bizarre as it was  bewildering.

We were told to take the A train, not to the stop for ALL the other shuttles, but to stay on to the end of the line and transfer to the Howard Beach Station of the NYC subway system and wait there for the A train.  Then take that to the Aqueduct station, go to a meeting point where we will be taken to the hotel.

A bit of background.  I know that station b/c I lived in the neighborhood for two decades and was there when they built that station.  It is located in a primarily commercial section nearly of whose stores are closed at that time and is practically deserted.  

So here we are, two senior citizens, with 4 pieces of luggage, waiting on an isolated station in a system that has recently been the subject of a mass shooting, stabbings, multiple assaults and people being pushed to the tracks.  All to wait for a train which is notorious for criminal activity.  Why not just put a target on our backs.

Next we are to lug 4 pieces of luggage off the Air Train, onto the A train, off at Aqueduct  and to an undescribed meeting place in a location we know nothing about.  

It gets better.  We took a cab whose driver was situationally challenged and cost us $36.  Upon arrival, we were told that for an additional $30 - $25 if you pay cash - you can get a ride to the airport the next morning. We paid the cash.

Breakfast? The others give complimentary breakfasts.  Here, the Hyatt costs you $25pp - a total of $50.  So, for what the others give gratis, Hyatt costs you an extra $100- something you should add to the cost of your stay.

When I travel later this month, I have decided NOT to stay at a Hyatt - there's a price to pay for non-performance.  Oh, I wrote to Hyatt and asked for my points back.  I'm still waiting for a response.  

Make your own decision where to stay.  I've made mine.

title: Amazing
text: Friendly staff, excellent service. Very quiet rooms. Felt very safe here. Great place for a little gambling as well. Easy access to the train/subway. Had a great time. Will definitely stay here again when traveling to New York.

title: Great place to Stay !!!!
text: This Place is and was amazing!!!!!! It was our first and definitely won’t be our last time to food was great , slot machine we’re very generous and the hotel was immaculate and the Staff was very Welcoming! ESPECIALLY A GENTLEMAN BY THE NAME OF NEAL 👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👸🏽

title: Goddaughter's bridal shower at Sugar Factory
text: My goddaughter's bridal shower was at Sugar Factory so staying at the Hyatt Regency made it easier for travel purposes. No complaints and although I was sad about the condition of Queens in general (25 miles per hour, heat, 1 car lane, long lines) resting in the hotel was a big relief at the end of the day.

title: Best Birthday stay in My Town.
text: I was celebrating my Birthday and want to stay in my area. I usually go to the Resorts Casino,but nevet thought about staying at the Hotel. When I walk in on Saturday, August 6th is was not but surprising and fun.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: The hotel was clean. You are warmly greeted by the staff. They try to accommodate your needs. Highly recommend this hotel. It heralds back to the days when the hotel experience was something that you look forward to.

title: Not really an airport hotel
text: If you're tired after a long flight and need a place to sleep and wake up and have a nice breakfast, this is not the place for you: the rooms are nice (it's a new hotel), but the hotel is far from the airport (the taxi driver kept asking us if we were going in the right direction) and the food is beyond expensive and mediocre ($3 for a banana, for instance).

title: The hotel is beyond beautiful
text: The hotel is amazing.. they give you a robe and slippers for free.. you can connect your phone to this big big beautiful TV.. I live in ny and I’ll still stay the night at this hotel and gamble… It’s amazing!!! But the only thing I don’t like is the $100 deposit fee for each night. I feel it should be only one fee regardless of how long you stay just like other hotels.. but besides that I love this hotel it’s 5 stars quality

title: Great stay at the Hyatt Regency RW JFK
text: Beautiful executive suite.  Well appointed modern rooms.  Regency club was well maintained.  Quiet on a week night.  Staff was extremely friendly and gave great tips for getting over to Peter Luger's for dinner.

title: Great hotel but no shuttle
text: We chose something close to the airport for convenience and it was a real disappointment to learn they do not offer shuttle to and from the airport, which is our opinion a must have. Also, we were expecting a better breakfast, which by the way was not included. Not even scramble eggs? Yeah it can be way better. Cheers.

title: Great place to stay
text: My flight got canceled so I had to make last min reservation, staff was very helpful and amazing. Breakfast was not the greatest, no varieties and not much options for kids. Other than that very clean rooms and new facility

title: Great Airport Hotel but No Shuttle Bus
text:
Besides Grand Hyatt SFO, Hyatt Regency JFK might be the best U.S. airport hotel I have ever stayed at, in part because it might not be entirely correct to call it an airport hotel.  I found the hotel to have more in common with Las Vegas casino resorts than a NYC airport hotel, but if I had a long layover at JFK I would consider returning.

Hyatt Regency unfortunately does not have a shuttle bus and is about 10 minutes away from the airport compared to the numerous “real” airport hotels which are 5 minutes or less.  After considering the cost of taxi back and forth it can eat into the value of staying at HR if intending to use it only for a brief overnight.

I booked the entry level room and I was proactively upgraded to an Executive Suite as Globalist guest.  The room layout was almost identical to Grand Hyatt SFO hence the reference to it above, the room had two full bathrooms (one of them with bathtub separate from a stand-alone shower) and minimal use of carpet which I loved.  We had sunset views of the city sky line far in the distance from our 9th floor room.  Surprisingly the bathroom amenities were not the regular Pharmacopia found at other HRs; normally when hotels deviate from brand standards it’s for a cheaper variety, but here it was rather Le Labo to give a small taste of Park Hyatt instead.  

The Club Lounge near reception was open and we had breakfast and happy hour there.  The space was not very large so I wonder if it can get full at times but it was not during our brief stay.  Breakfast did not stand out one way or another except they had smoked salmon which was a plus.  

For happy hour I am normally not a big fan of lounges in North America but at least once again it was not an overly crowded zoo therefore it could make for a decent place to relax and have a drink, which included canned mixed drinks but strangely the wines were in cans too.  There was a small salad station and bite size appetizer warm dishes which I found to be above average for a lounge in this part of the world, especially at JFK airport.  

If I did not order room service, my stay might have been close to perfect.  Unfortunately more than one hour after ordering we still had not received anything and when I called the restaurant there was no answer so I called reception and they could not get a hold of the restaurant either.  Eventually someone called me back to indicate that they had no staff available to bring my food to the room hence the delay, and that they would send a bell boy instead.  When the food arrived I was surprised to see that it was in plastic boxes in a bag rather than usual room service tray or cart.
