If I only had a layover of less than 12 hours I might look at more convenient alternatives closer to JFK airport than HR, but if having close to 24 hours (needing late check-out for an evening flight) and spending lots of time in the hotel, I would definitely pay again the 20-25 USD Uber each way because the value of staying at HR is excellent, I know my odds of suite upgrades will be better than other hotels, and HR has a respectable lounge.  So this is a hotel I can recommend when being aware of the location drawback for people not using the hotel as a casino resort but more as an airport hotel.

title: HORRIBLE
text: This was very Unacceptable there was no comfort for me and my wife the heat in the room was unbearable. Our stay was interrupted by waiting for some one to come fix the problem at which it took 12 hours for someone to come verify the heat was on and can not be tune of or put in AC.

title: Large Casino - Comfortable Rooms - FREE PARKING
text:
You had me at FREE PARKING.

As a New Yorker, parking tends to revolve around every outhing. General hotel parking in NYC will run y ou $60+

Being able to park and reenter the lot for free, as many times as I like is a major plus.

The Casino is clean and has every slot you could imagine. Of course, no live table games as NYS law.

The beds/Rooms are comfortable, clean, and quiet.

title: real estate  broker
text:
i love the overall front desk services.,  The room is very nice  especially  the bed.
The security of the place is  secured because  if you do not have the card you cant check enter any room.
beautiful  location & view from where i stay 8th floor

title: Clean and elegant but...
text:
I am a big fan of the Hyatt brand. This hotel is modern and clean as expected from a Hyatt Regency. But a few things need management attention. My first room had a loud constant buzzing coming from the wall or ceiling. A bell boy came to examine and shrugged his shoulders - "that's just AC". Excuse me? Just AC in this caliber of a hotel? That's just poor maintenance. 
Luckily there was another room available and it was quiet. But it had a mini fridge that emanated bright light all night and was impossible to turn off. Coffee maker in the room was nice, but what is up with the powdered creamer for coffee? Are we now in Motel 6?

title: My vacation
text: The hotel clean and customer service great. Just would have liked that the basic toiletries were given at check in. I was coming straight from jfk where my flight was delayed for a day and I didn’t have any of these in my carry on

title: A Good Hotel Near JFK
text: The Hyatt Regency JFK Airport offers a nice location, not too far from the airport. I found their team to be kind and helpful. Yet, you need to know that there is no pool and restaurant availability is different than usual. There is a small Hyatt Club for breakfast, but a nonhyatt restaurant the rest of the day. With the Hyatt Regency name, one would have expected more.

title: Pleasant accommodations and enjoyable stay
text:
Having extra bottled water delivered to my room was very convenient.  I would have struggled to open my room door without dropping the bottles had I carried the water up myself.  

Being an early riser and avid coffee consumer, I would really enjoy having real creamer available for the in-room coffee.  I appreciated having both the breakfast and chamomile tea available in the room as well.

The bed, pillows, linens, towels, lounge area, desk area and bathroom were all comfortable.  Brighter lighting options would be most helpful when having to work.  Perhaps a floor lamp could be added in the lounge area.  The TV screen size was incredible, a real treat!

I appreciated the diversity of food and beverages available in the Market, as well as the generous hours of operation.  The diversity of dining options at the property was a real treat!  I did not have an opportunity to enjoy the breakfast/happy hour at the club lounge this trip.  The price and hours on the hotel website require updating, based on information provided at check-in.

Based on the reviews, I was concerned about possible elevated noise levels in the hall and adjacent rooms, however, that was not my experience.  It was wonderfully quiet during my stay.

The signage directing to the front door of the hotel could be improved, mostly for travel in daylight hours.  The hotel sign at the start of the drive up to the canopy is a little low in height and GPS was guiding past that entrance.  GPS was easily ignored at night with the lighted signage guiding the way.  The door to the hotel is just down from the canopy, which is odd, so that could be improved to help weary travelers access the front desk without using too much brain power (especially when arriving around 2am).

title: Clean, neat and overall satisfied.
text: Quiet location even close to airport. Meet my expectations. I am frequently customers. Overall clean, early check in late check out always great. Not too long waiting check in. Great services and great hospitality .

title: Hyatt Regency JFK Airport Hotel
text: The rooms are amazing!  Cathedral ceilings and bathrooms larger than my first apartment!  The beds are very comfortable.  The place is really clean.  The hotel staff goes out of their way to accommodate you.

title: Well located brand-new Airport and Casino Hotel near JFK
text:
The hotel is brand-new and right next to a large resort and a steakhouse (Sugar Factory) which appear to be popular both with locals celebrating birthdays / gambling and with airline staff / pilots and passengers that have had flight cancellations.

While the rates are a little expensive, the hotel is in very good condition and the staff is very friendly - would definitely recommend.

title: Excellent condition but bad location
text:
The rooms are new and modern with a super large TV. They do not have a microwave in the room, and most items on their request sheet are unavailable. But all these cons are dwarfed by such excellent hardware. They offer automatic daily room service, including changing sheets, which might be very rare nowadays when most hotels stop doing that with the excuse of COVID. There is also a responsive texting number to contact the front desk.

The disadvantage is that the breakfast is unpalatable and has very few choices. It has JFK in its name but does not provide shuttle service to JFK. Instead, they offer a shuttle service to the nearest subway station. So you can imagine how difficult to get to the hotel and leave for the airport. What makes it worse is there is basically nothing in the neighborhood. A trip to Manhattan or Flushing costs at least an hour and a half. So I would not recommend this place to people who want to take a flight or hang out in NY city.

title: Hyatt Regency JFK
text:
I booked this trip months in advance after reviewing several hotels in the area. I arrived an hour early and was able to check into both my rooms. Unfortunately there were no suite upgrades available on a Tuesday, which may speak to how popular the hotel is. But I can see why. The hotel itself is relatively brand new and is beautiful. The rooms are nice and spacious. There is also a restaurant and casino connected to the hotel. We had a regency club access, which gave our group the opportunity to get snacks/drinks during the day and breakfast in the morning. 

We were traveling into Manhattan while at this hotel and it's roughly a 30-40 minute drive during the weekdays. There is however free parking which was very helpful. The regency club is listed as open late night for drinks but they apparently stopped that earlier this year so it closes at 8pm. Also, some of the rooms are listed as "city view" for a higher price/points.....There isn't much of a city view and all you get is view of the casino parking lot.  These were my only issues. The aesthetics are probably the main draw and I would probably stay here again.

title: Amazing hotel
text: This is the best hotel that I have ever stayed in in the United States. Very modern and super clean. It was attached to the casino and had a Sugar Factory as well. I loved my stay and will definitely be returning in the near future. I love being a World of Hyatt Member.

title: A Perfect Staycation
text: I was experiencing some miscommunication w/ my reservation on the Resorts World side. Liz, from Hyatt customer service came to my aide, and saved the wknd! It was a great mini escape for a much needed girls ' trip... thank you, Liz!

title: Great place to stay!
text: The rooms were spacious and the staff was great! They have an assortment of products if you happen to forget something! The 24/7 snack bar is great for people flying in late or leaving early. OverLl great place to stay.

title: Beautiful hotel close to airport
text: Hotel is beautiful!  Rooms are well decorated and service was great.  As a globalist we received an upgrade to a beautiful suite and found ourselves on a quiet corner which was great.  The lounge had great snacks as well.  Would recommend for anyone who needs a hotel close to JFK or for a staycation if you want to play in the casino.

title: Excellent!
text: The Hyatt Regency is a very clean and quiet hotel. The staff is very kind and accommodating. I cannot see myself staying at any other hotel in Queens when I visit again. In addition, I enjoyed playing at the casino and the drinks at the Sugar Factory.

title: Problem solving NOT part of customer service!
text: Poor communication and dining options are practically zero although they advertise for dining options not available.   Service at main restaurant (Sugar Factory) is inconsistent and items ordered forgotten - had to ask several servers for items forgotten (dressing, salt/pepper, extra napkin).  You have to flag them down to get a check after waiting 15 minutes when done eating.   Not cool.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Hotel is close to JFK airport. Check-in was fast and easy. Staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel is new and very clean. Lots of parking. Casino, restaurants, and Starbucks coffee in lobby. Only downside is the walls were so thin, we could hear someone talking on the phone next door, and could even hear the person on the other end of the phone as well. Only experienced the noise one of the 3 nights we stayed.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: CASINO TRIP
text: A conveniently located hotel. Close to the New York airports. Proximity and accessibility  to the resorts world casino makes it a great place to stay. Casino lovers and those who love the night life will enjoy its convenience. Some additional forms of entertainment are needed.

title: Awesome place to stay for the weekend
text:
Awesome to place to stay for the weekend.  Quiet and relax location if you don't go to casino.  The facility is located out of nowhere near the tack track and JFK.  Traffic is hash around the areas.
Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  William, Alicia, Bibi and a few others at the Club Regency were super friendly, helpful and happy to serve.  They seemed to enjoyed their jobs!!

title: Good stay in NY JFK
text:
Amazing new room 
Everything was fine
Good dinner in thw dedicated area
Good people at the reception
I was sorry to stay only for a limited transit period
I planned to come back to visit NY again enjoing the stay in Hyatt JFK Hotelt

title: Beautiful and Convenient
text:
I chose this hotel for a one-night stay after returning from Europe before my 5-hour drive back home and it was a great choice.  The room itself was large and beautiful with a comfortable bed and sofa.  The bathroom was also large and had a convenient automatic light (but only a shower, no bathtub--which was fine with me).  

I did not pick the hotel because it was adjacent to a casino, but that was a nice perk--I managed to avoid the temptation to gamble but did enjoy the casino bar.  

Although there are signs for valet parking, the parking is all self-parking when I was there, which worked out well because I could park in the valet parking lot near the entrance to the hotel.  Getting to the hotel was a little confusing because the signs were all for the Aqueduct Race Track and Resorts World Casino, but following the signs to Resorts World will get you to the hotel.  

This is a good hotel for a pre-flight or post-flight stay or just if you want to stay at a nice hotel in the NYC area.

title: Can A Casino Hotel Be Really Good As Just A hotel?
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency JFK in May when we had an overnight before flying out of the country. We had pretty low expectations since we figured it was a casino hotel. Boy were we wrong.

The room was modern, comfortable, spacious, and clean. The bed was super comfy.

There's a deli/bakery/coffee shop in the lobby that has very high quality packaged food. There's also a restaurant attached for anyone wanting standard restaurant fare.

The real star is the club lounge. The service there was wonderful and the food was simply outstanding. I'm talking high quality restaurant food. They also offered some nice drinks during the complimentary happy hour.

Then there was the staff. They just couldn't do enough for you.

Overall, we were just blown away by the really nice room, the really nice staff, and the outstanding club lounge. If there was a shuttle to and from JFK then this would be perfect but we still plan on staying again.

title: Unsatisfied
text: Long wait time to check in and our room was not cleaned. We had to wait over an hour to get checked in and when we finally got to our room it was dirty. Housekeeping did not clean the room and we checked in at 12:30 am. We had to wait over 45 minutes to get a new room key for a clean room.

title: Great place
text: This hotel was a great stay. The room was great and so was the staff. Definitely a 10 of 10 stay. My wife and I will be returning. I will recommend this place to all friends and family that come in town.

title: Nice New Hotel a Short Ride from JFK
text:
Nice new, clean hotel on spacious casino property. Globalist status recognized nicely — upgraded to a suite with a view of the NYC skyline. Regency Club had a nice selection of alcoholic beverages, appetizers, desserts.

Room was comfortably large and had a beautiful new bathroom. My only complaint is that the air conditioning was stuck at 59 degrees despite setting the thermostat at 70.

If you’re into gambling, casino is pretty clean as well. 

Easy ride to JFK and a nice stopover the night before an early morning flight.

title: Hyatt winner!!!
text: Great location, facility, staff and amenities!  The bed was very comfortable and room was spacious especially for NYC! We will return when visiting and/or flying out of JFK. *****Try it you will not be disappointed

title: Great place…Clean, Safe, and Friendly
text: Great place to stay. Safe and the staff is friendly. I travel to JFK every week, I had to give up on the Hilton because it is a dump. This place is great. I highly recommend this hotel. The food prices are high due to the recent stolen election and implementation of Communism.

title: Pros and Cons!
text:
Beautiful, huge modern rooms. No shuttle service from Howard Beach Airtrain station, which is just stupid—it’s 1.3 miles away. So, close to JFK, yes. But not convenient. Great staff.
 The full (horrible) service restaurant is not operated by Hyatt, and is expensive.

title: ZERO Focus on the Customer !!!!
text: In a nutshell: Room thermostats were broken, couldn't be fixed per management & hotel engineering because they were on a wireless control system that was outsourced and they weren't available for support out of hours or on weekends, room temp was 59 degrees, begging for blankets at front desk at 1 AM. This place sucks!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Beautiful new Hotel.  Would highly recommend this hotel.  A little far from New York City, approx 50-60min subway ride.  Subway is outside of hotel for easy access.  Beds were so comfortable and the room was very clean.

title: Discrimination
text: Very disappointed with check in procedures. There was one long line when I walked in for 3 check in desks. One of the check in windows was labeled clearly “World of Hyatt”. I asked the people in front if they were part of “World of Hyatt”. They said no. I went ahead to that window to ask the lady if she can process me since I am a world of Hyatt member. She avoided the question and said there is a line. Wasn’t clear if she was referring to a world of Hyatt line or the 1 long line. I waited until she processed another couple and than asked again my question if this is a specific Window for “world of Hyatt” only to be told no. I went back to my place in line. While waiting the white couple behind me cut and went to her window and we’re taken care of. Being Muslim and Indian, dressed not as elegantly due to my difficult travels to see my children after many years of pandemic. I did feel a feeling of discrimination. I leave it to you to decide. I’ve been a World of Hyatt member for years and this is the first time to have such an experience.

title: Cunycow
text: Hyatt Regency JFK, Its Service is  TOP OF THE WORLD, NO COMPLAINTS, When I CHECK-IN LATE, Like 11PM, They give me a room on a Second Floors.  Then i told them i want a higher Floor Room. They were just happily switch me to the 9th Floor.   I Just want to say Thank you.

title: Hyatt Regency (Resort World) near JFK Airport
text:
A good place to stay if you want to comfortable layover for 1-2 days if you stop by NY and your meetings are around the neighborhood or in Brooklyn / Queen area. 

The facility is good where the room is comfortable and nicely done up. 

Service staffs are very helpful and the breakfast buffet is a good option if you've the time to have a decent breakfast and want to enjoy that in a relaxing environment for that 1-hour.

title: Wow!!! Super impressed
text: This was a beautiful hotel with a beautiful view of the city. Jonathan was THE BOMB!!!!! He was what really made the difference for me. He was personable and he not only told you about the room but also about what to do. I haven’t been to New York in a decade so his information was helpful. I don’t gamble but the casino is literally in the lobby. I went there for drinks and live entertainment. The room was SPOTLESS! not even a random hair in the shower! Brian (I hope I remembered right) from housekeeping was a doll! This was a great experience. I love to see the security. Made me feel safe. The outside of the building was lackluster but once you walk in, you will be WOW’d!

title: Great
text: I came to celebrate my birthday and had a wonderful time everything in one place we dined at the sugar factory for was ok then went to the casino and saw a group called the counterfeiters they were awesome.

title: Over $3000 overcharged at Hyatt JFK even after they were warned twice!
text:
A total s$&t show this hotel . A bunch of amateurs running a hotel. Stayed one night with room service before a flight out. Warned the hotel several times that it appeared that my $100 room service bill had turned into an over $3000 bill. I told the room service attendant that the bill seemed wrong but she ensured me the number above the signature line was the amount to pay and the over 3k number underneath was Hyatt points. I am a Hyatt locality member so it could have made sense .

The next day on my check out bill I saw the 3k again and warned the front desk. I was again assured this was an oversight and that there was no hold on my card.

After I flew to Rome and the next day I got a noticed of my credit card company that The Hyatt at JFK at charged me for over $3400 , the $300 plus stay and room service in addition to the over $3k I had warned to hotel it appeared to be charged twice! Needless to say that you don’t want a 3K amount pending on your card when you travel.

I called the hotel . Billing department always had an answering machine on and never replied. Hotel number was picked up by someone remotely and when she picked up the phone (after many attempts without anyone answering) she had to transfer me to the Hyatt and I got disconnected. When I called back she blamed me for getting disconnected. I didn’t do anything other than listening to music and hearing someone picking up the phone and disconnect me.

But sure blame the guest for being stupid , hey it was also my mistake they you grossly overcharged me by 10 fold and I probably should have told the hotel another 20 times that they were making a mistake.

Also my mistake that your business center printer had no drum in it. I should bring one next time when I am staying at a Hyatt. Also my mistake that I had stained linen… will bring my own when I stay at a Hyatt next time. And how stupid of me when I call the hotel number to think that someone that answers the phone is actually at the hotel instead of answering a phone remotely! I thought only 5 bedroom B&B’s in off season did that. 

Grow up! Run your hotel professionally. Apologize for your MASSIVE mistake and correct it immediately . Not only that compensate the stay. This is such a gross mistake! Train your staff so that they understand what they are looking at and know what to do. From checking in till check out no-one had a clue what they were looking at or even how to activate a door key. 

Do yourself a favor and stay at another Hyatt and let staff explain you how to run a hotel. Even for an opening year these mistakes are beyond anything one should expect.

Still the problem has not been resolved , probably it will end up disputing the charges. Swallowing the fact that I spend many hours of my well deserved vacation to deal with the inability of a hotel to manage things correctly and likely a lawsuit because in any capacity is a 10 fold overcharge and the issues it is causing me during my travels sufficient to have the hotel pay for their stupidity !

Thank you Hyatt JFK for showing how children manage a hotel!

title: Good location, beautiful hotel
text: If you’re traveling thru JFK, this is the best hotel for you. Considering the location, cleanliness & welcoming staff. We could have stayed longer if we didn’t have an early flight to catch. We were also a comp bfast buy was not able to take advantage.

title: Perfecto
text: Beautiful perfect place cant agree more on the service that they provided it was super clean and beyond greeted with nice people. Felt safe and had alot of security around to make sure me and my wife were. Safe

title: Jamaica 60 year anniversary experience
text: Great location and service...attended the Jamaica Consul General of New York Jamaica 60 year anniversary at the hotel and had a great experience. Event was well attended by various elected officials from the USA and Jamaica, and the food and entertainment was very good!

title: Room are very clean and cozy
text: All is so great and very welcoming except the view outside the window of our room. Room has a very large glass window. Unfortunately we were assigned to a room  with all the  exhaust and electrical facility view when you look outside the window. I wonder how the front desk based their choices to assigned guest to this type of room.

title: Dee's Review
text: I am so sorry to see that many of the comp rooms are no longer available to those of us that lose so much money on a regular basis at the casino. I guessed that means that all of us would revert to other accommodations.

title: Good hotel, but not really an airport hotel
text:
It's a new and we'll maintained hotel. However it advertises itself As an airport hotel, yet is quite some way from the airport and has no courtesy bus
The staff are friendly and helpful and organizing a taxi back to JFK simple enough, just wish it wasn't necessary

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Our short overnight stay was very nice and comfortable. Since we arrived late, we were not able to take advantage of the amenities at the property; however, our room was excellent. The bed was very comfortable was well.

title: Birthday Trip
text: We were going to a friends surprise birthday party and looking for a nice place to stay.  the hotel was outstanding.  We are not gambelers so we did not go to the casino.  The room was great and we had an excellent nights sleep.

title: Room was overbooked so they sent us to a dirty room
text: After our flight was canceled we called the hotel to book a two queen bed room. We immediately went to hotel where we were told they were out of queen rooms. Hotel staff said they would clean a room for us. After waiting 20 minutes we were sent to a room that was dirty and the ac was broken. It took an hour since check in (and 5 minutes of me sobbing in the lobby) to a room that was clean The staff seemed more annoyed with our situation than interested in helping.

title: Sharda
text: I enjoyed my stay at Hyatt Regency JFK Airport at Resorts World New York. The room had a nice view and it was clean . I love the cleanliness and the big king size bed.The casino was an experience that I enjoyed . The drinks were a plus .

title: Always Satisfiedf
text: I've enjoyed at least five stays at the Hyatt Regency JFK Resorts. The customer service is above average. The rooms are always clean with an airy feel. The rooms are spacious. I have zero complaints and look forward to my next visit.

title: Zero sound proofing between rooms. Terrible rush construction job.
text:
Expect to hear every word your neighboring rooms occupants have to say. Especially after a long night of gambling and losing. 

You would expect some level of sound proofing right? No these walls are the definition of paper thin. You can hear all the plumbing of the jet toilets in other rooms, clearly hear word for word what other rooms are saying, and the large televisions are so loud.

Just a pretty pile of modern garbage. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone even if it was convenient.

This hotel was clearly rushed through construction and its a total lackluster shame to be attached to the Hyatt Regency branding.
Knock it down, and build it with privacy in mind.

title: Resorts World Hyatt - JFK Airport Best in Class
text: This hotel retains its new look and feel. The staff is helpful and courteous, there is also a real commitment to security. The only thing lacking is that there is no dedicated hotel bar. Of course the casino is built right in, but its a long distance to one of the bars there and it would be nice to have a cocktail bar away from all that sound and commotion.

title: Close to the airport
text: It was a nice Hyatt! It was very clean. My wife loved the bathroom with tub and walk in shower.  We did enjoy the happy hour.  They only bad was the size of the room for breakfast.  It is small with little seating. It was great for happy hour.  The room is a little small for breakfast.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would go back again. Also forgot, the best part was the GREAT CUSTOMER service!!

title: Lovely Hotel - Taxis are an issue
text:
I stayed here for one night as a Hyatt Explorist and thought the hotel was very nice. However the main event is the casino it is attached to which makes the hotel a second guest and it had little atmosphere. The room was lovely, large bright and quiet. The bed was super comfortable and very modern bathroom. All the amenities were great.

My issue was the location - not he way there I got into a stand up row with the taxi driver as he couldnt find it (and wouldn't take my directions) and he got very aggressive. On the way back I asked for a Town car - and got a beat up car that I would not class as a Town car. I had also asked for a taxi with a card machine but the one I got didn't have that so we had to stop by a booth to pay before I travelled.  Why this hotel does not have a courtesy bus I do not know - but the lack of one will mean I do not stay here again.

That is a shame as the hotel is lovely. Lacking a little in bars and restaurants so I had a meal from the shop.

I am unlikely to stay here again because of those issues.

title: Beautiful and brand new
text: Beautiful, brand new hotel with friendly staff. Easy access to Manhattan from Aqueduct Racetrack station. Coming back at Aqueduct N Conduit a little tricky, so recommend some research on walking direction to the hotel beforehand. Will definitely stay again pre-departure from JFK.

title: Very Nice Hotel
text: We booked this hotel for our London trip. My kids love this hotel. Their staff are very friendly. Their breakfast tastes delicious. We will go back to this hotel next week. The location of this hotel is very convenient and only 10 minute driving to the JFK airport.

title: Sweet Dreams
text:
Memorable stay!  Friendly, informative, clean. Very close to JFK airport. 
Amazing breakfast buffet and small plates dinner are available with unlimited happy hour beer wine and margaritas!!!! 
I highly recommend it worth it!  Very affordable!

title: Fantastic
text: Clean security outstanding hotel food very good only one failure the RW PRIME STEAK RESTAURANT awful my suggestion would be to replace it with another steak house it was over priced food awful and not friendly at all I would not recommend anyone to visit or eat there quality awful I know the hotel has nothing to do with this restaurant just my added opinion in case someone visit the casino and hotel

title: Angella
text: My experience at the Hyatt Regency was a pleasant one. The Hotel and room was very clean and sanitary. I love the shower and the large absorbent towels. They provided complimentary water and coffee. It was a pleasant visit.

title: Beautiful Modern Hotel
text: We totally enjoyed this gorgeous hotel and room. I stayed for a visit with friends. We had a beautiful view of the NYC skyline.  Service was excellent . The Casino was clean and beautiful. I would highly recommend it!

title: Angry Security
text: The room and amenities were wonderful but the security will make you want to leave. The security team has one angry person on the team who makes the entire team look angry. He seems as if he is looking for a reason to be rough with guest.

title: Excellent Service
text: Staff was welcoming and friendly. Very sanitary. Room was very clean.  Very quiet.  Security was excellent.  I recommend for anyone who's staying overnight from a flight out of JFK airport.  I will return.

title: Fantastic
text: Can't wait to go back. My stay was peaceful I would recommend anyone to come. Wish you guys had more options for food but other than that the place was great. Rooms are very tidy quiet and respectably pleasant. The staff is great keep up the good work and thanks

title: Great experience
text:
Incredibly helpful and attentive staff.  Room was immaculate and had plenty of helpful amenities.  Attended a conference on site and was very pleased with the support they provided the event.  I will absolutely stay in this hotel again.
The only negative (and it wasn't bad, really) was that other than Sugar Factory -- the onsite restaurant -- there wasn't much to do or going on close to the hotel itself.

title: New Hotel close to JFK and La Guardia
text: Overall the hotel is new so it is very clean and pretty. The attached casino is fun.  We did have an issue with the heat. They did offer to give us another room.  Easy access into new york city Via the A train

title: Madinjay
text: We had an amazing staycation! Check in was smooth room was absolutely beautiful loved the shower. The soap products for the bathroom are the best I’ve ever smelled or used. Security was on point with making sure only guests had room access.

title: Nice hotel, still needs some tweaking
text: Rooms are clean, it is a long walk from the parking lot (which can be a nightmare to navigate!) to the hotel check-in.  Motion sensor lights have bene adjusted but still turn on as soon as you get near the bathroom - at least this time they didn't shut off unexpectedly! Thermostat in room would not allow temperature below 75 degrees - made for uncomfortable sleeping.  Was not greeted as a WoH member nor did I receive the bottled water I should have gotten.  I would still stay again as it is super convenient to where I work and much better than a few other local name-brand hotels.

title: ROOM WAS NOT CLEANED
text: I am writing to you to let you know of the horrible accommodations at your hotel at the Resorts World Casino in NYC. I have stayed many times at this location, but my reservation for 3/4 - 3/6 in room 231 was so bad, that I left. Upon entering the room, we smelled a scent of food. Upon closer inspection we noticed that we were given a room that was not cleaned. There were food containers, used napkins and beverages in the bathroom trash, the refrigerator was missing the complimentary water, the bar of hand soap was open and used with its wrapper on the sink, the towels were used and just left hanging in the bathroom. My wife and I were so disgusted that we went downstairs and left the property and stay at home. This was supposed to be a weekend getaway for my wife’s birthday where we were gonna stay, gamble and eat at Sugar Factory but that was ruined.

title: Fun visit
text: The staff are nice, security friendly, check in, check out quick and easy and the rooms are very nice and clean. In most hotel I have visited would have a small store with souvenirs or you may be able to get small item like tooth paste if you forget to pack but they don't have no where to even get a Tylenol or Allergy relief if you forget, so don't forget anything.

title: Much more than I expected.
text: The feel of the hotel is like a 5 star hotel. The decorations, the ceilings. The room is simple but spacious. The ceiling to floor glass window is awesome. Very clean, staff are great, security is topnotch! Casino gives money! Tons of machines. Food choices in the casino are a lot! Loved my stay. Will be coming back this week.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
Enjoyed the hotel and amenities. Hotel staff wonderful. 
No pool or health club as of 2/18/22 but I understand they will be installed soon. The only complaint was the room floors were not carpeted. Linoleum Flooring. Bare feet or socks get dirty. Track it into your bedding. . Relatively newly built hotel.

title: Best stay
text: Nice stay great rooms big TV comfy big bed overall great hotel experience. I'd recommend it to all of my friends and family. Not tge windows or views. But, the experience was well needed and appreciated

title: Great times and great food
text: Brand new hotel. Loved everything about it. The amenities alone were the best part. From the Sugar Factory to the casino. Bonus that the A-train is literally connected to the hotel. Felt very safe walking around as well

title: This is it!
text: I think I discovered my new comfort zone. This hotel gives me that atmosphere I like. It's 5 Stars for sure. I am in "My World" when I am in this location. I can always feel the comfort of relaxing here.

title: Great place to be
text: The walls are too thin . You hear everything from the other. rooms . There was a couple shouting and fighting all night. I could not sleep . The casino is easy access from the hotel . Lots of places to eat .

title: Amazing!
text: This hotel is what every hotel should strive to be! The staff members go above and beyond to ensure the comfort of their guests! This wasn’t my first and definitely will not be my last! The only thing I would recommend is room service and/or more breakfast options!

title: Muy buen hotel cerca del aeropuerto JFK
text: El hotel está situado cerca del aeropuerto JFK en Nueva York y en un complejo con un casino, aunque prácticamente no hay nada más. El hotel está muy bien las habitaciones grandes y tanto el desayuno como la cena, aunque no haya demasiados platos, lo que hay es bueno y de calidad. Vale la pena

title: New hotel
text:
The suites are not available due to a “maintenance issue” from other reviews I don’t think that have ever been available. The “mini fridge” is one of those wine coolers and pretty useless if you actually need something cold. Other than that, seems pretty good. I was only there about 8 hours. Regency Club had some evening stuff and salad that was ok. I left before breakfast was available. Free parking in NYC is a great thing even with a bit of a walk.
Vey Expensive cash price, I would not have paid $300+ a night and if I did an then found out there was nothing to upgrade to, I would have been very unhappy.

title: Unexpected surprise…
text: It was a wonderful stay and we will definitely be returning TY the help went above and beyond to make our stay one to remember..  the Casino is and added pleasure. TY Hyatt Regency JFK Resorts Hotel NY.

title: Cunycow
text: I had Excellent Experience during the stay at the Hyatt Regency JFK, their Staff is friendly, the Place is clean, Parking were Easy, i would recommend my friends and family members to stay in that hotel also.

title: The room was amazing and the housekeepers was great..
text: The hotel would’ve gotten 5 stars if the check in clerk would’ve verbally told us to park in the right parking lot there was no sign on the doors to not park at a parking lot and the lot was open with a lot of ppl parking there.. and then they wouldn’t even help us get out of the snow.. they wouldn’t even give us a shovel. And security was supposed to check on us and they never did.. also They need more restaurants..

title: Staycation Getaway
text: The hotel room was spacious and clean. Room service was limited.... probably due to COVID restrictions. It's great that the casino and hotel have collaborated, and I look forward to returning. I will recommend this Hyatt Regency JFK at Resorts World NY to friends and family.

title: Expected better
text:
As a new property with a casino, I expected a far better experience than I got with this Hyatt location.  
Although they advertise this as a JFK Hyatt, there is no airport shuttle offered.  I had to spend sixty dollars on ride share, round trip.  

The staff at both check in and check out were indifferent and did not make me feel welcome as an elite status holder.  I wasn’t offered any of my benefits.

There is no traditional breakfast or room service, just a Starbucks with overpriced grab and go cold options.  

This was not worth the added cost compared to other hotel brands near the airport.  Not for business travelers.

title: MY TRIP
text:
Hotel is a very nice to stay. Service, a very clean rooms, It's very convenient for business trip, friends visit or for short vacation. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.
I appreciate great customer service and room service

title: Our stay
text: Beds were too soft for the us. We are both disabled and such soft beds are difficult to sleep on.  The bedding was rough, but immaculate.  For a one/two night stay before you travel, it’s a nice place. It is attached to a casino making it easy to play.

title: Personal day to relax and spend some down time. it was also a casino day and I had the best time at the casino and the h
text: Personal relaxation day away from work and family. I spent part of my day in the casino and the other part in the hotel. I enjoyed the checkin process and the room was very clean and up to date. There were a lot of things to do at this facility

title: My stay at Hyatt Regency - Resort World in NYC
text: Hotel was very clean and modern. My only concern was the lack of heat when it was cold. I also wish there was more eatery spots. Sugar Factory is awesome place to go for food. Casino is downstairs and you can play slots and listen to band perform. It was a nice experience.

title: Exceptional Service!
text: Resorts World Casino is my favorite casino.  There are so many amazing and wonderful things to see and do.  The new hotel is the most comfortable hotel I have ever stayed in. I had a fantastic time. Thanks so very much for a most wonderful experience and stay. It is one of my favorite places to go to rest and relax now.  On a personal note:  The bed in my hotel room was so soft and wonderful and I especially loved the down comforter on my bed as it was soft and amazing!  What a special experience!

title: My 1st stay at JFK HYATT REGENCY
text: I stayed at the new Hyatt at resorts in queens 1night,  the rooms are amazingly clean. The beds are so comfortable.  The staff is friendly and very helpful, I will recommend to all to spend a night or 2.

title: Comfortable, Clean, Great Staff
text: Great hotel, new, clean, gracious staff. Rooms are comfortable. Very convenient to get to JFK. There is a Casino attached for those who are into that. Cute restaurant within the compound that has a good selection of American food called the Sugar Factory. Adults & kids will love it.

title: A Great Place and so close 2!
text: A great getaway. If you have the time come on over. Clean and beautiful rooms as well as great restaurants.  The casino is open all night and steps away from the room. Security is close by if needed and the view is also nice. The 6th floor even afforded us a look at the fireworks in the neighborhood.  All in all, a wonderful experience.

title: Amazing!
text: Stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip and it was excellent!  I requested work book me a Hyatt since I like the brand and am very particular about cleanliness and quality in hotels. Very clean, every employee I encountered was friendly, rooms were nice and clean. Onsite security ensures non-guest don't enter the elevators.  Attached to the casino which was also very clean and safe/classy 110% happy with this stay.  Snack bar/coffee was very good but the hotel needs a restaurant/cafe instead of the fast food options at the casino.

title: Not as Expected
text: I was very disappointed. I was assigned room 637 and it was not cleaned.  Bed wasn't made, towels on the floor. Was moved to another room 639 that had a bad odor, stained white towels. Very disappointed. I paid alot for this room. Hope you can make this right. Thank you,  Catherine Tirado

title: Hyatt stay
text:
Recently stayed at the Hyatt at Resorts Casino and had a great time. Very clean and looking great! 
Everything was on point and to my liking. Room was very well arranged and inviting. King size bed was very nice and the shower was awesome! 
Enjoyed my stay!

title: Pricey !
text: Prices too high for a “ holiday in express “ level of a room that they called suite. Website of hotel does not provide pictures of room, so it’s like a “ lol surprise” resulting in face of dissatisfaction when a city view room direct view is just a parking lot or sort of a casino back entrance. Price too high for the quality.

title: Finding Nemo
text: Lovely new hotel relatively close to JFK. The taxi from JFK battled to find it and so too the UBER driver to collect me the following morning.  The best way to get back to the airport, particularly for early morning flights, is to ask the hotel to call the taxi service they use most because otherwise you may end up paying UBER for a pick up that doesnt actually take place. I took a taxi that had been called by the hotel to pick up other guests who didnt show. The rooms and bathrooms are really nice and new;  very comfortable new beds. I had issues with temperature controls in 2 rooms and moved between them as maintenance corrected the issues. Overall, this hotel provides a great alternative to the other very old hotels serving JFK. My room was on the 5th floor facing the entrance of the hotel and it was amazingly quiet. I would definitely stay at this hotel again now that I know how best to deal with the issue of finding it.

title: Felt clean but over priced
text: It was a nice room. It seemed clean when we got there. Staff was nice. The value just didn’t match, for the amount it cost for one night just didn’t seem like we got what we were paying for. There was no fresh breakfast and the one food spot they had in the lobby it was insanely expensive for pre made and pre packed food.

title: No coffee sold in early morning.
text: hotel should offer or sell coffee earlier than 6am. It’s an airport hotel and should have coffee for everyone taking early morning flights. Instead, I had to drive to Dunkin Donuts at 5am. The coffee machine in room doesn’t cut it.

title: Excellent staying
text:
Clean, bright, safe, great services. With gym but no swimming pool. 
The building is connected to the Resort World Casinos which is great entertainment if you like to try your luck. Unfortunately due to COVID, there’s only a handful of food choices available in the building.  However, you can always UberEat or drive 5 mins to a lot of the local restaurants. 
Overall I am very satisfied of my staying with Hyatt JFK.

title: Thoroughly pleased and surprised
text: l work at a hotel that need to have ours employees and management see a blueprint of how a first class hotel of choice goes about its business. Great experience. This is definitely where I would have family or business partners that I want to impress stay

title: Pet policy issue
text: I visited this resort on 12/13-12/15. It was an invite based on prior slot play at RWCNYC. I had inquired to RWC on their pet policy with regards to pets being allowed on the casino floor. I was assured via email that there would be no issue and I just had to pay the pet fee $75 and fill out the pet policy form. I frequent Hard Rock Casino inTampa and I never had any problems. So when I get to RWC I proceed to casino floor my first night, first they ask is my pet an emotional support dog, I said know but show security the email that was sent to me from the customer service rep from RWC. They allow me onto the floor, but the next night I’m hit with resistance because the security guards were not told that I could bring my pet on the floor so they called their security manager, Mr Laranzo (I don’t know his last name, nor would he give it) So I spent 25 mins lostening to this man explain the rules and such! I had emailed RWC prior to my traveled so that I would not have this type of situation! The security staff said that if they allow me to bring my pet chihuahua on the floor, then everyone would want to bring their pets! I read the policy on the website and also emailed CS two weeks prior just so incidents like this would not happen! The security manager and their staff were ill advised and both Hyatt Jamaica/RWCNYC need a staff meeting regarding the resorts policy and procedures on pets. My trip was ruined after this exchange and I will not be returning.

title: An Unexpected Diamond in Queens
text: I was shocked and amazed at this beautiful hotel attached to the Resort World Casino.  I was not expecting the elegance that greeted us when we walked in.  The staff were Top Notch!  I was there to celebrate my birthday and the agent, Jeffery, made my birthday so very special.  Our room was beautiful and we had a special birthday dinner at the Sugar Factory located in the hotel!!!

title: My stay at Hyatt Regency
text: Upon entering the hotel the entrance was beautifully decorated with Christmas decor. The ambience of this place is heartwarming. Clean rooms and beautiful scenery. Very friendly customer service representatives who go over and beyond to make sure your stay is memorable.

title: Excellent
text: The Staff is Amazing, and Security is Visual And the The check points to make sure everyone has the COVID’s shots.  Felt Very Very Safe! I truly enjoyed eating at the Surgary Factory and the Desserts were Soooooooooooo  Good!   The Lobster Tail& Steak Delicious.   Must go back again and Very Very Soon!   I wish they would do a New Year Bash and give me Complimentary Tickets and a Complimentary Room for New Years Eve!    I will Definitely be There!

title: Great experience
text: Hyatt Regency JFK is available for weekend getaways birthday party and just spending time away from home The sugar factory restaurant is a plus on the hotel location also a great view of New York City

title: A Great Experience
text:
My experience at the Hyatt Regency JFK Airport was nothing short of amazing.  The rooms are big and quite spacious, the tv is huge and the bathroom is quaint.  The bed was extremely comfortable.   It helps that they have restaurants and the casino right downstairs. But my favorite part and I do mean my favorite was breakfast.  OMG, the best breakfast with unlimited choice of meals to choose from.  

I cannot wait to visit this property again soon

title: Great Stay!
text: I stayed at the Hyatt because I was comped a few nights by Resorts World Casino. The hotel was immaculate. Everyone was welcoming. The rooms are spacious with everything you need to be comfortable like wireless phone charger, Keurig coffee machine with many different coffees and teas, large flat screen tv,  wry comfortable sitting area. Everything was great!!!

title: Excellent
text: I was a great experience staying at Hyatt Rengency. I do recommend everyone to experience this beautiful Hotel. The place is so peaceful! I love the beautiful views where you have a chance to look at the city view at night, it is amazing.

title: Nice hotel thin walls
text: Hotel was ok for the price and location even though it took a good 30-40 minutes to get to Manhattan! Walls were not insulated at all and normal conversation could be understood word for word! Make sure you’ve had your shots as restaurants will not accommodate you!

title: There is no shuttle
text: Take a taxi to the hotel. Don’t take the hotel shuttle. Spent an hour trying to get to the hotel. When I got to the hotel and they said they don’t have a shuttle. Wish I would have known. I need to have 200 words so I will keep  writing and writing

title: Hyatt Regency Manhattan quality if not better, in Queens, NY
text: The room was very clean. Beds/bedding were comfortable. Bathroom fully loaded and very clean. So clean, my daughter dropped butter from a bagel on the floor, I wiped it with a white cloth not a spec of dirt. Clean

title: Family visit
text: Daughter’s birthday celebration. Very convenient. Hotel was extremely clean with view of Manhattan. For an extra fee, food and unlimited drinks were a plus. The Christmas decoration was beautiful for the festive spirit.

title: STAFF ARE STRICT U CANT FORGET YOUR KEY
text: I was upset with the management I felt HARRASMENT by security because I had forgot my key they should be less harsh on the people that stay there we loose and win a lot. So please be nice to the ones .

title: Excellent stay before long flight
text: I'm happy to have stayed at the new Hyatt Regency with my family. Everyone got good rest and peace of mind before our long international flight. Staff were all friendy and helpful. Hotel was clean, and I felt safe. We also used the club lounge, and the quality of food (breakfast) and service was above my expectations.

title: Gorgeous, I love everything about this hotel also my gaming at the casino.will definitely stay again
text: Gorgeous, I love everything about this hotel also my gaming at the casino.will definitely stay again soon. I booked it for the rest of the year, this weekend it’s for my family and ito enjoy, both hotel and casino.

title: Hotel was overbooked get down graded while check in
text: Hotel over sell the room and forced to downgrade. We booked one night suite for hotel. But was  downgrade for regular king room (really small and not bath tub) while we check in in front desk due to over booking. If hotel could at least give me a call let me know we got down grade ahead, I could have a chance to cancel booking and have alternative plan of my trip.   Tell me room was over booked and gave to other, feel have no choice and was forced to accept downgrade offer. Hotel refund the price difference and no any addition compensation.

title: Very nice clean & inviting property
text: My trip was based around my celebrating my 58th birthday. I was at the casino three weeks prior and was not asked for vaccine status. I invited a companion to come and he was unable to get into the casino :(. So that put a bit of a damper on my celebration. Other than that he brought me a beautiful bouquet 💐 of flowers and we ate in the room

title: Enjoyable
text: I had a really nice comfortable time at the hyatt regency. The rooms were more than words can say.  I would reccommend them  and the location to anyone.  The staff was very friendly and helpful when I came across a problem with my room.

title: Awesome
text: Really nice and clean rooms with modern decor and accessories. Food was great and so was the customer service at check in.  I would recommend this location for your next stay. Its perfect for a weekend getaway with friends.

title: Good not great
text:
FIRST OFF, THERE IS NO COURTESY BUS FROM JFK, NOT FROM THE AIRPORT, NOR FROM JAMAICA STATION. This was a real surprise to us, cost us an extra $50 and an hour of hour time, after a long haul flight, could have done with put that
Once we got there, things improved. The front desk were great, the ladies in the coffee shop friendly and helpful and even the security guard was all smiles
The hotel is very new and the rooms and facilities show it. Restaurants are limited but what there is, is good
Another thing of note is that the hotel is there to serve the casino and as such, for the casual traveller or someone using it as a lay over hotel, the facilities on offer are.limited but sufficient. 
Overall a tad soulless, but once you work out how to get there great as a layover location, just get a taxi from the airport

title: Amazing Stay!
text: The whole front desk team was phenomenal. Jeffery (the agent who checked me in) was so knowledgeable & made the whole process so easy. Everyone from security, to the bellman to the managers were always smiling and also amazing every time I passed them. Thanks for a great trip cant wait for the next one.

title: Too much for the money, not what I would expect of a resort hotel
text: Bathroom floor floods because of shower drain, safety hazard with the bathroom door, no traditional breakfast available without more money, all information is found through QR codes - expect that in a medium rent place - not a resort setting, all cable viewing is what you have on your phone - they don't provide, snotting front desk, poorly marked hotel entrance, not designed well for handicap customers

title: great clean new hyatt attached to world resort casino nyc.
text: i highly recommend this new hyatt hotel next to casino, it was clean, fresh, not crowded and was nice for a quick couples getaway! Our room was super clean, spacious and the bed was so soft! hubby and i went to celebrate 10 years anniversary for a quick getaway. it was perfect

title: great spot near jfk airport and attached toi resort world casino and Aqueduct racetrack
text:
Staff was great. Location perfect. Only thing missing is JFK shuttle. The snack bar had good selection.
I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to jfk. Close proximity to public transportation.

title: Hyatt Regency at JFK visit
text: Great rooms with great amenities such as largeTV and  shower. Good to have a refrigerator and ample closet space. Very quiet room that was ideal for sleeping and rest. Definitely will come back again soon.

title: hyatt
text: excellent stay clean friendly. Staff was very helpful. Ordered a movie and food. Bathroom and amenities helpful. Christmas trees and decorations nice touch. will visit again soon. surrounding area and parking plentiful

title: What a wonderful surprise
text: We enjoyed our stay at this beautiful property from beginning to end. Check in was a breeze with lovely staff catering to our needs. The rooms was absolutely gorgeous with ceiling to floor windows, spotless, very modern and a nice view of Manhattan. We will be back.

title: Très Agréable
text: Hotel parfaitement situé après un atterrissage ou avant embarquement à JFK. Agréable et propre dans l'ensemble. Chambre spacieuse et lumineuse. Metro et taxis toujours disponible. Le tour de l’hotel est rénovée, propre & sécurisée

title: Loved the experience
text: The rooms are cozy  , the bed was soft and comfortable  the bathroom are large and well lighted , and its very convenient to get to, and having the casino there for pleasure is a added bonus. The food in the restaurant was also very inexpensive.

title: The best in Queen NY
text: Brand new very clean beautiful hotel. In the heart of everything..few miles there is the shopping mall in both direction...if you want to do a little gamble just walk over for the night life. Very safe.

title: Beautiful as always
text: I will come here each and every month I love your hotel more than anything I love the best little pens you give us I was hoping a can purchase a box of them but I love the comfortable bed and the sofa

title: Abysmal Customer Service
text: Bottom tier of customer service I experienced at a Hyatt brand property. I made multiple pre-arrival phone calls to the property regarding billing questions, staff never greeted themselves by name on the phone nor identified their position - so I never know who I am talking with about my money. The phone staff also spoke very unprofessionally, using slangs and answered the phone "What do you need?" when asking to connect the call to front desk. During one call when I was finally able to get connected to the front desk after a long hold, the answer to my question on whether or not I can pay with a Hyatt Gift Card at the property was "I think so" by the front desk. They never offered a definite answer to a simple question. The phone calls and playing tag with staff left a horrible taste in my mouth before even arriving, and their Google Reviews show 2.6/5 stars as well.

title: Very clean
text: Very clean quiet and comfy. Highly recommend. Courteous staff, very helpful and polite. Food was pretty good. Nice bathroom and beautiful decor. Was very pleased and happy with accommodations and stay

title: Weekend getaways
text: I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. The lobby of the hotel was cozy with areas for reading, lounging and eating. Inside the  hotel room was clean and modern looking. The staff was friendly, respectful and they were upfront with the charges. I will definitely return.

title: Excellent service Excellent stay
text: I had a very comfortable stay at this Hotel. The service was exceptional and l would definitely recommend a stay here and will be staying here again myself. The staff was extremely friendly and very professional

title: Hyatt Regency JFK Airport
text:
Beautiful hotel.  Great staff.  Very welcoming.  Plenty free parking. Ms. Stephanie, the Manager was extremely helpful and handled all my requests immediately.  Definitely will stay there again. Room has a fridge and a microwave and coffee machine. 

Suggests they need some valet to park your car and take your luggage upon arrival at the hotel. 
Stephanie did send my luggage to my room from the counter.  Thanks.

title: BEST HOTEL YET!
text: My first time staying at this new hotel next to the Resorts Casino and it didn't disappoint! Spacious room, so clean and all the bells and whistles, from extra phone charging outlets, to a sensor light in the bathroom, as well as a lighted make-up mirror. Best yet there was no carpeting on the floor so you know it could be maintained clean.

title: Exceeded Expectations, Great Customer Service
text: I booked here on October 1st, 2021 and I had a pleasant, comfortable, and luxurious stay. Employees were so respectful and knowledgeable about the hotel. Although I booked a city view room yet got the parking structure view, hotel manager Bryan immediately took action himself without any question, he moved me to the city view room. (view is very important to me) His and his team's customer service is above and beyond. The club lounge was so clean and the food was very delicious and freshly served. The hotel was very clean and pleasantly looking. Not a single complaint towards Hyatt JFK.

title: A Welcomed Getaway
text: The hotel lobby was welcoming, bright and I like the design/decor. Staff was welcoming and provided me with what I need. I like the room and the comfort of the space. The rooms were cleaned daily and the service crew accommodating to my needs.

title: Recent Stay at Resorts World
text: The facility and it's staff was exceptional. They were very friendly and customer focused. They seemed to want to ensure that you enjoyed your stay. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone going to the NY area.

title: Hyatt never disappoints!
text: Hotel was nice and clean. Staff were friendly and helpful.  Nice little getaway with casino, sugar factory restaurant and free parking all in one. You don’t have to leave area. Hope it stays this way.  Highly recommended.

title: First stay at Hyatt Regency
text:
Go experience it for yourself! It was Sweet and Fun.
My main reason for going to Resorts World was to receive free gifts all weekend.
Resorts World Bathrobe with their Logo in Gold letters on the top left side including their Tote bag to carry. A $20 dollar Gift Card for the Sugar Factory.

Thank you.

title: Just the right Hotel in the Queens Area
text: Brand new hotel in Queens-NY. You have some nice views which are kind of rare unless you go to Manhattan. Lots of security in and out of the property. There is a Regency Club onsite which is a nice perk. I do recommend paying the extra for access to it. Rooms are 400+ sqf which for NY it's large. Just go and explore the property.

title: Excellent
text: The sugar factory was very clean food was good. My kids had a lots of fun taking pictures.not to forget the sugar candy there. I had fun in the casino with my husband also nice live music. Even the casino floor and machines was very clean.

title: Brand new with excellent quality and customer service
text: Clean, airy, and modern design with fantastic staff. Club lounge is especially welcoming and served delicious foods and drinks. Parking is free and plenty of space, but the property is so large that it was a bit confusing to distinguish between the casino and the hotel initially... There's not much in the area except for the hotel and casino. We were there for a wedding. Highly recommended.

title: Hyatt Regency at Resorts World
text: Newer property that will eventually be exceptional, not quite there yet but staff is learning. Rooms are brand new and would have liked to have had more dining choices.Overall clean property and would stay again if in the area. convenient to JFK airport.

title: Visiting family and friends
text: Came to New York for a family event.  The hotel is beautiful.  The staff was very  courteous and helpful.  The food options  were delicious we purchased items at the market and at restaurants located at the resort.  We also enjoyed being near the casino.  My family is looking forward to staying again

title: Got humiliated and treated disrespectfully by the floor manager
text:
I flew to NY from Seattle to attend a funeral. I flew red eye and got to the hotel around 7:30am. I was able to check in online and saw that my room was ready. But because I had requested to redeem a club access award in advance, I wanted to check with the front desk and make sure the award was redeemed successfully and that I would have access to the Regency club. Because the funeral wasn’t until the following day, I figured the club access would provide enough food and beverage options, and a quiet place to rest besides my own room. I didn’t feel like venturing out to the casino or outside the hotel in this trip. 
When I got to the front desk, Jonathan was courteous and helpful. But he saw the club access was showing up as an extra charge, so he called up the floor manager to help. The floor manager (whose first name might start with an R, wasn’t entirely sure because he didn’t even introduce himself) said I would need to call Hyatt and there was nothing he could do on his end. I was thinking to myself “aren’t I at Hyatt? Why couldn’t you help me?” But anyway I was already exhausted so I just called the Explorist line. And the agent said the hotel had to do it on their side and asked me to hand over my cellphone to them. The floor manager took my phone, spoke to the agent who taught him how to do it on the same computer that he said he couldn’t do anything. In the end everything seemed fine, but unfortunately that wasn’t the end of it. 
After checking into my room, I figured since I was checked in, I wanted to check out the club since it was still breakfast time. Jonathan who happened to be at the club checked me in after I entered the club. I sat down to get something to drink and some fruits. But then five minutes later the same floor manager walked in and came to me and said I wasn’t supposed to come in for breakfast until tomorrow morning, so either I left right now or I couldn’t come back for breakfast tomorrow.  I was shocked and didn’t even know how to respond. I was so upset but didn’t want to make a scene. I said ok and then he just walked away. I felt so humiliated by the way he spoke to me and how I was treated. 
I have been loyal to the Hyatt brand and got to Explorist status. But if that’s how I am going to be treated, I don’t know if I’ll ever want to stay at another Hyatt property ever again.

title: Great place
text: A brand new hotel with great staff.  Very convenient to JFK (although they provide no shuttle service to and from hotel to airport).  I would definitely stay here again.  If you have an early flight from JFK and want to sleep in, this is the place to stay -- otherwise, stay in Manhattan and wake up early to fight the morning traffic to the airport.  Very satisfied with this place.

title: Excellent except for a couple shortcomings
text: I am writing this from my hotel room.  The receptionist was friendly and the bellhop offered to take my bags to my room even after I told him that I had given all my cash to the taxi driver.   I am globalist and was given given a corner room on the top floor, but I doubt that it is bigger than the others.  The room itself is very nice.  The beds, pillows and linens are very comfortable.  Although the hotel has been open for about 5 weeks, there are very few people here.  During my morning walk through the lobby, I encountered about 5 other guests.  There are many more employees than guests.  My wife and I had our complementary breakfast in the Regency Club room and it appeared as though we were the first people in there this morning even though it had been open for over 2 hours.  The breakfast was adequate and the staff were very nice.  One big downside of staying on the top floor with so few guests is that it takes a very long time for hot water to make it up to the top floor.  We had to let the shower run for about 20 minutes before it became warm.  Another downside is the lack of a hotel shuttle.  It cost us $30 by taxi from JFK.  I told the taxi driver I wanted to go to the Hyatt Regency.  He had never been to the Hyatt Regency JFK so he assumed I wanted to go to the Hyatt downtown.  Luckily I had the address loaded into my phone and I was able to show him how to get here.  TIP: have the address available for the taxi driver and check your phone to make sure  you are being taken on the correct route.  Another downside is that the safe did not appear to work.  Since there are very few people here it seems to be a safe place to be during a pandemic.   Overall, this hotel is very nice.  I would definitely stay here again since it is a very good use of Hyatt free night certificates.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Absolutely highly highly recommended. 5 stars hotel amenities with comfortable pricing. Very close to the city with Casino and wonderful restaurants. Check in was easy. Snack bar also serves Starbuck Coffee, delicious sandwiches and warm meal are also available. Everything is here. I had wonderful and excellent stay. I had so much fun playing Slot Machines at the Casino as well.

title: No airport shuttle, bad taxi company, no elite benefits
text: No airport shuttle, nobody answer the phone, called many times, no human body to take the call.  No soap on the shower dispenser.  No room upgrade. Wet elevators.  Requested two wake up calls (two different days), no calls received.  Requested a taxi, took more than 25 minutes to get the taxi.  The taxi driver was not wearing a mask, he was not stopping on the STOP signs, and he was trying to charge me $10.00 more than what we agree departing the hotel.  Uber and Lyft got lost (4 times) and they cant find this hotel.  As a Explorist member I just got two bottles of water for the stay.

title: Terrific service is a core value at this clean, modern hotel in the Big Apple
text: After a long, tightly masked flight transiting the Atlantic to New York, my wife and I endured sluggish service from surly officials in the poorly staffed Customs/Immigration at JFK. Our cab ride to a nearby Hyatt Regency was circuitous, to put it mildly, as the driver of this dirty vehicle looped far afield before dropping us at the front entrance. Thankfully, situation changed dramatically for the better as soon as we entered the gleaming doors of the clean, fresh and welcoming new Hyatt at JFK. Reception staff went out of their way to swiftly check us into a beautiful upgraded suite at the end of a quiet hall where we could catch our breath and clean up. A quick walk through the hotel before dinner revealed a hotel equipped with modern conveniences, crisp security and a well-appointed Regency Club staffed by friendly and helpful people. Check-out next morning was a breeze, with bell desk handling bags and a smooth, professional driver for return to JFK for our early flight. If you are looking for relief from the current hassles of travel, this Hyatt will make the trip worth your effort.

title: Travel Nurse
text: this place was so nice i decided to bring my family while i worked and they loved the rooms and stay next time i have an assighnment  in NYC i will bring just hubby so we can gamble and hang out on my days off.

title: JKF I HAVE SOMEWHERE TO STAY
text: Hyatt JFK excellent place to stay for business or pleasure. Quick escape, close by.  Rooms are relaxing and no carpeting on the floors, great for someone with allergies. You have a room, the casino, and places to eat. You will not be disappointed

title: Clean and Comfy!
text: As a NYC native, we always stay with family and never at a hotel when visiting. This was our first time at a hotel and it was perfect! Great staff, rooms brand new and clean! Bathrooms need more privacy since barn doors do not stay closed. Otherwise, excellent experience. Having the casino a few steps away was an added bonus! We can’t wait to stay again soon!

title: HORRIBLE EXPEREINCE
text:
I received a COMP room with a reservation.  Had several communications with the facility upon arrival.  Once I arrived I WAS NOT GRANTED my COMP room although I provided all my proof.  This was my birthday weekend and I was there celebrate with friends and attend the event at Sugar Factory.  This was the most disappointed experience I ever experience with Hyatt Regency.

I had to pay $399.00 plus tax for 9 hours check in process at 1230 checked out 9 am

title: Horrible checkin and front desk floor manager
text: Very rude and unaccommodating. Horrible check-in process at the front desk. Night shift floor manager was horrible - Absolutely no value for a globalist stay in this hotel. Will never stay in that hotel again.

title: Newest and Good Hotel in Queens, NY
text:
Little disappointed about the a Valet parking not provided and no Guards and post at outside Main Entrance Lobby. No announced or post about service restrictions.
Except above things.
Overall good and cleaned newest hotel.

title: Amazing hotel and friendly staff
text: This hotel offers amazing room and bathroom amenities,  convenient location, adequate parking, great nightlife and of course the Sugar Factory! I highly recommend checking them out, you and your friends/family will love it!

title: Clean and modern!
text: We really enjoyed staying here.  Beautiful rooms with clean and modern styling.  Wonderful Le Labo toiletries.  True apartment/residential style rooms.  Like our own fancy Manhattan apartment at Resorts World New York City!

title: Excellent place to stay for a vacation
text: I highly recommend this property, all the staff are very good, we stayed 2 nights and my family and kids thoroughly enjoyed the stay. I wish there is a swimming pool, but instead we went to beaches, lots of fun.

title: Pleasant stay at the Hyatt Regency
text: I have not stayed at a hotel in a couple of years  in New York that is, I found everything was too perfection the front desk was quick smooth easy , , I had a feeling of being safe  And comfortable there was plenty of security everywhere.  very convenient to be able to walk right into the casino I loved it and I've stayed in many hotels this was a good day

title: Beautiful New Hotel
text: The hotel is gorgeous all around. Staff is accommodating. Room was clean, well stocked, and modern. Even had a wireless phone charger! The only problem we had was that we couldn’t get room service. We called multiple times and kept getting sent to voicemail. Eventually we had to go down to the restaurant in person to order takeout and sit around to wait for it, which negates the idea of room service all together, especially with the risk of covid. It was disappointing. Otherwise, this stay was wonderful.

title: My stay at the Hyatt Regency hotel was wonderful
text: The place was decorated in a beautiful style and the room was very big and stylish and spacious it had a nice view of the area and the casino was easy to get to every one followed covid 19 procedures I would recommend for everyone to go there you will enjoy it

title: Wait til growing pains done. Not worth the premium dollars. TWA hotel 10x more value. Don’t expect a clean room.
text: Not worth the premium dollars. Not ideal for jfk stay. Rooms are 90% done. Lots of little issues. Wait til they figure it out. Construction in mining wakes you up!  Maybe they will grow into the property.

title: Great stay!
text:
Very clean, brand new hotel with a friendly staff in all areas. Was upgraded to a suite which was great. Regency Club was fun and had good breakfast and enough for a light dinner from 5-8:30. Friendliness of the staff, the clean and modern room, and the Regency Club was the best parts of our stay. A nice gym with treadmills, ellipticals, bikes and weights. We checked out the casino, but it was not why we were there, so we didn't linger, however if that is your thing, it is attached. There is a restaurant onsite that looked fun, but we just stuck to the Regency Club as it was not crowded. 

If you take the subway, you can walk through a skyway through the Casino, if the weather is not ideal.

title: staycation
text: very nice hotel .  rooms were clean but a little small.  The shower was great.  We ventured to the casino.  the entertainment at the casino was enjoyable.  We ate at the Sugar Factory.  Although they initially they got my order wrong, it was quickly corrected and the food was terrific!

title: Invited hotel guest
text:
My stay was exceptional. The staff members were very attentive. True professionals. Hotel very clean. Floral arrangement in the was impressive. Ample parking.
 The Sugarland eatery was clean. Food good.

title: A great place to stay and have fun.
text: The Hyatt Regency by JFK is a fabulous place to and try your luck in the Casino. I did very well in the Casino so it made my stay even better. The rooms are very nice and clean. I’ll be back soon. Looking forward for table games.

title: Very nice hotel
text: The hotel staff was very professional and friendly. The hotel room was spacious and beautiful. Everything was clean and looks brand new. I recommend anyone should stay at this hotel!! I loved the view of the city

title: Above & Beyond!
text: This is the place to be. It's very clean, extremely friendly, safe & close to everything.  It's also  just a hop, skip or a jump away! The Resorts World Casino is conveniently steps away from this tranquil Hyatt Regency experience.

title: Great place and decent amenities
text: Love place and wish I return back.Just better some explanation about additional service at charge or for free when checked in. Also expect more event or amenities in the Hotel as well as the promotion program. Anyway. I enjoyed the night lovely.

title: Pleasant experience
text: The room was clean and comfortable.  the staff on checking in and checking out was pleasant and friendly.  However I gambled all night and needed about an hour more time in the room but was refused a late check out.

title: Vacation
text: Hotel is brand new. Beautiful  place , staff is courteous and helpful. Room was very clean upon arrival  . They don’t have a cafeteria. So , the restaurants nearby are extremely expensive. It’s also very hard for Uber or Lyft drivers to find the location. Walls are paper thin . So, upstairs guests were very noisy. Maintenance started working and banging on a wall nearby at 8 am. Woke me up with a headache. Worst feeling ever. Other than that no complaints , facility is beautiful and well kept .

title: Good
text: It was a personal trip for myself and my friend. We love to gamble and had a great time. The restaurant suck! Please get more restaurants. Also, drinks need to be served while gambling. Make it happen.

title: Excellent
text:
The Hyatt Regency at JFK was emaculate. Clean, COVID compliant,  efficient  check in and out, convenient   There are a variety  of shops and and places to satisfy  the palate.
Nice views.  The rooms are clean and accommodations are great! I loved the body wash and shampoo. Delightful. 
I really enjoy my stay. The Casino is spacious  too!

title: Excellent staycation!!
text:
We can’t imaging how rested our first staycation we had at this new hotel! 
Hotel is epic, room is modern and clean, most importantly the customer service was exceptional. Special shout out to Shanini from front desk, Alicia from Regency Club, and Fatima who served on the 10th floor. We feel the Hyatt hospitality from everyone. It will be a plus  if there is a swimming pool.

title: Great experience
text: Great experience, the entire staff was great and everything was clean. I like that the house keeping was always available. I hope the service stay the same. I will recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family when in the area.

title: Great experience
text: This was my first time staying at a hyatt and it was great. Casino entrance was in the lobby making it convenient. The staff was amazing although some portions were understaffed as its new but hopefully it gets better

title: Satisfied 😁
text: I was impressed with the staff at the hotel,  everyone was well trained and informed. Valet services was not available at the time, so parking was a little far away accross the outdoor parking lot. Otherwise we had a wonderful time and we will be returning soon!

title: Needs more amenities
text: Hotel is beautiful. But it needs more activities and restaurants. I like that it is directly connected to the casino without having to step out of the hotel. Sugar Factory was great though. Overall, needs more features added to hotel.

title: Disappointment
text:
Good Day. 
On August 13th,  I was so excited to spend a night of play and rest at the Hyatt which I PAID FOR. No comp room. I had planned on leaving work (which I  did), getting a car and going straight to the hotel to rest and nap for a few hours then get up and play at the resort. I was very excited that I did go play for a lil while expecting to come back to the room for a nap and then shower and get ready to go back to the resort for a night of FUN. Upon returning to my room approximately around 6:30, which was VERY cold to the point that I wanted to turn OFF the air conditioner but I couldn't because there seem to be some type of malfunction. I couldn't even take a shower because I didn't want to risk getting sick. I called down to the front desk and told them about the A/C and this open panel box in my bathroom with some type of device hanging out of it. Pics are attached. I spoke to Heidi (Manager) who said that someone would be up. I waited for an hour and NO ONE came. I then called again and she informed me that she put the claim in but if I wanted to leave the room just give permission for them to go in. I wasn't doing that. Heidi then told me that someone would be up in about 15 mins. I waited another HOUR and NO ONE came. I then went downstairs to see her and showed her the pic of the open panel and the reading of the air conditioning meter. She told me that she would switch my room. The keys to my room was delivered, I went to the new room, 521 from 539 and guess what??? The key did NOT work. I finally got inside about 10pm. I couldn't get enough rest because my body was tired. I love nice hotels (which yours is) and I feel my planned day definitely didn't go as planned because of the poor service and poor attention given to my needs. Again, I was excited to see your hotel open and wanted to be one of the 1st to patronize and use it the opening weekend. I paid over $400.00 for that ONE night and was denied a late check out. I wondered had I experienced this treatment if I was a white man or old white lady? And I understand that's kinks would happen due to it being new. Attached are pics I took of 2 of the problems. I wish you all the best on the future and do hope and know that things will get better.
Thank you

Waliek Crandall 
718 813 9972.

title: Great stay!
text: Staff was friendly and warm, from the front entrance to the check in was greeted with great help, sugar factory food was delicious, room was clean and was smelling fresh, we will visit again for sure!

title: Decent stay
text: It will be a great location if you are taking flight or get some cash at casino. No bus shuttle provided at this moment. It is brand new, I went there on the second day of opening. It is nice and clean.

title: Come now before it gets crowded!
text: The brand new Hyatt Regency at JFK airport is wonderful. It has to be one of the cleanest spaces I have stayed in over the past year.  The gym is amazing and since it just opened, most of the time it is empty.  It was a great experience staying there and I would encourage people to go before it gets crowded when more people hear about it.
